title: Avionics System Engineer - Equipment (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

As an Avionics Systems Engineer you'll be part of the Avionics team working on the VoloCity with a focus onsystem development, integration and verification activities.

Your Tasks:


 * Performing Requirement Management of system/subsystem/equipment level requirements in the Avionics domain
 * Performing the requirements validation and support of the requirements verification activities
 * Addressing the problem reports and managing change requests for the allocated system
 * Preparing and performing the system and component design reviews (PDR, CDR etc.), internally and with suppliers
 * Supporting the development assurance activities (e.g. system audits with authorities for ARP 4754A compliance demonstration)
 * Supporting the generation of the compliance evidence for the certification (test plans, design reviews, analysis reports etc.)
 * Facilitating the integration activities of the newly developed and COTS equipment (e.g. review of the test procedures, environmental qualification gap analysis and others)
 * Working closely with specialists in a multidisciplinary team
 * Participating in communication with the certification authority
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Degree in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, communications engineering or related field
 * Minimum 5 years of proven experience in aerospace development
 * Detailed knowledge and practical expertise of ARP4754A and DO-160
 * Knowledge of the certification deliverables for the Type Certificate programs in CS-25/23/29/27 programs
 * Proven track of requirements engineering with requirement management tools like Integrity or DOORS
 * Experience in working with suppliers for the "build to specification" development and COTS integration for aircraft systems
 * Thorough analytical skills, troubleshooting experience and a structured approach
 * Excellent written and spoken English
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Experience with software and airborne electronic hardware standards DO-178 and DO-254
 * Experience in working in EASA approved Design Organization (Part21J) is preferable
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Avionics Expert (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here atVolocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft -eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis and othereVTOLsoff the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. Our aim is to offer affordable, on-demand air taxi services that fly people to their destination quickly and safely. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever piloted flight of a fully electric multicopterand have since conducted more than 1,500 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You are an avionics system expert with proven record of certifying airplanes or helicopters, and you are passionate about making a difference in eVTOL aviation. Requirements management, system design as well as change and problem reporting processes are tasks you are perfectly familiar with. You have experience in planning and producing certification evidence and communicate and align with certification authorities. Within a highly motivated and skilled team, you will ensure that system development, integration, and verification activities are performed in cost, time, and quality. You will shape the future of how pilots control an eVTOL aircraft.


 * Performing requirement management of the system/subsystem/component level requirements in the Avionics domain
 * Performing the requirements validation and support of the requirements verification activities
 * Addressing the problem reports and managing change requests for the allocated system
 * Preparing and performing the system and component design reviews (PDR, CDR etc.), internally and with suppliers
 * Supporting the development assurance activities (e.g. system audits with authorities for ARP 4754A compliance demonstration)
 * Supporting the generation of the compliance evidence for the certification (test plans, design reviews, analysis reports etc.)
 * Participating in communication with the certification authority
 * Facilitating the integration activities of the newly developed and COTS equipment (e.g. review of the test procedures, environmental qualification gap analysis and others)
 * Reviewing and approving test procedures and test reports related to Avionics integration tests
 * Ensuring proper verification of problem reports using the test rigs, aircraft, or other test means
   
   

Qualifications

Required Skills


 * MSc, PhD or equivalent degree in engineering / aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, communications engineering or similar work experience
 * Minimum 10 years experience with aircraft (avionics) system design with sound experience in aircraft certification (CS-23, CS-25, CS-27, CS-29 domains)
 * Experience in working in EASA approved Design Organization (Part21J)
 * Experience in the Avionics functions and technology for the communication, navigation, surveillance, indication, crew alerting, data recording and others
 * Proven track of requirements engineering with requirement management tools like Integrity or DOORS
 * Experience in working with suppliers for the "build to specification" development and COTS integration for aircraft systems
 * Detailed knowledge and practical expertise of ARP4754A and DO-160
 * Very good English language skills (written & spoken)
   
   

Preferred Skills


 * Experience with software and airborne electronic hardware standards DO-178 and DO-254
 * Expertise in CS-ACNS and SC-VTOL
 * Knowledge and practical expertise of ARP4761
 * Expertise in Human Factors standards
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Battery Systems Engineer (Validation)  (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Our custom-built Electric Propulsion System consisting of state-of-the-art battery, power distribution and controlled electric motors are key to making Volocopter’s products extremely safe to fly. With your specific experience in the development of electrical system for aviation or in integrating electric propulsion components into mobility products, you contribute directly to the certification of this uniquely safe and simple flight experience. As an integral part of our Energy Storage Unit (ESU) component development team, you ensure that the proper system development processes are followed by the battery and power distribution teams. 

Your mission during this flight: 


 * As System Engineer you will work closely with colleagues in multiple disciplines to valid requirements, design descriptions, functions etc., at system and component level to meet aircraft level needs.
 * Ensure completeness, correctness and fulfilment of battery requirements
 * Handling internal system engineering process aligned with development lifecycle needs, including requirements management and program milestone deliverables.
 * Ensure successful completion of the V&V program of the battery.
 * Assist in creating the certification plan for battery systems.
 * Take ownership of component design description documents, interface control documents.
 * Perform design reviews of the battery systems & interfaces.
 * Define test articles for sub-system, component, sub-component or part validation.
 * Provide technical review of the design to ensure the complete coverage of the requirements.
 * Specify and support the validation and verification activities of component requirements according to ARP-4754A
 * Provide support for formal audits and exchanges with EASA, as needed.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or equivalent.
 * Strong experience in process and requirement validation.
 * Good knowledge and several years of experience with systems engineering, requirement management, and system architecture in aviation (ARP4754) or other complex product development.
 * In-depth understanding of EASA's SC-VTOL and E-19 regulations and the certification process for batteries used in aviation applications.
 * You have a background in Battery development and have applied experience with DO-311A.
 * Knowledge of certification and development processes and have applied experience with DO-160G.
 * Team player, confident in technical discussions, ability to organize and “get things done”.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Basic knowledge of HV and Li-ion batteries, digital communication buses, and/or model-based systems engineering.
 * Experience with FMEA and FMECA 
 * Experience with battery modeling and simulation tools, such as MATLAB/Simulink.
 * Project management skills with the ability to lead and coordinate verification activities within a multidisciplinary team.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: FBW Systems Engineer - Flight Control (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You are a Senior System engineer experienced in the development of complex systems and you are passionate about making a difference in eVTOL aviation. You have substantial experience in system architecture and requirements engineering and a profound knowledge of the verification and validation aspects in aviation, and in particular fly-by-wire flight control systems. Within a multi-disciplinary team, you will coordinate between the various teams and systems to ensure a successful certification of the Flight Control Computers of the Volocopter aircraft. You will shape the future of eVTOL aircrafts.

Your Tasks:


 * You will support with requirements management at flight control level with a focus on the control computers (including e.g. functional-, safety-, regulatory-, environmental-, and performance requirements).

 * Knowledge of certification processes (Part 21) and requirements under EASA (CS-23,CS-25,CS-27,CS-29, ideally SC-VTOL).

title: Validation and Type Testing Engineer Railway (f/m/d)
description:
Welcome to Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering and R&D projects. As a consulting and services company, we help the world's most innovative companies realise their full potential: From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, we think outside the box across a wide range of industries.

We are looking for you for our Systems Engineering & Product Design team! Together we take abstract product ideas and turn them into working products, managing the development process throughout its lifecycle and efficiently meeting customer requirements using modern tools and methods.

Join us and take the opportunity to shape your career at Capgemini Engineering and experience every working day with enthusiasm!

Your Tasks And Responsibilities With Us


 * Creating validation plans for newly developed subsystems and design modifications, taking into account test stands, simulation tools, etc.
 * Reviewing circuit diagrams, design change documentation and validation reports.
 * Constructing and reviewing the specifications for train and train lab-type tests under all relevant operating conditions.
 * Collaborating to optimize the testing scope across the laboratory, train, and train lab, while developing and evaluating documentation for type tests (including test instructions and reports) for both train and train lab.
 * Executing functional type tests using a test case database.
 * Conducting static and dynamic tests on trains and train labs, both at our Salzgitter location and in external environments.
   
   
   

You Convince Us With


 * Bachelor, Master or Diploma of Engineering specifically in the field of Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.
 * Qualified electrician or electrotechnical instructed person according to DIN VDE 0105-100.
 * More than 5 years work experience in functional / train testing (including specification, execution, and analysis) in compliance with functional and design requirements.
 * Relevant experience in functional engineering for railway rolling stock.
 * Knowledge of Microsoft Visio and Change Management System desirable.
 * Very good knowledge of English and German.
   
   
   

Not a 100% match? No need to worry! Capgemini Engineering supports you with a wide range of learning opportunities so that you can develop both professionally and personally.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU

Do you have any questions about the job profile and/or requirements?

Please get in touch with your contact person in Recruiting.

Natalie Natho, Recruiter Capgemini Engineering Deutschland S.A.S. & Co. KG


 * 49 (0) 176 1778 2047
   
   
   

natalie.natho@capgemini.com

Please fill in our online application form completely and attach your CV, work and school certificates as well as any other relevant documents.

We wish you every success for your application.

title: System Engineer Motor (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated System Engineer to join our team, with a specialized focus on motor development for aerospace applications. As a System Engineer, you will play a key role in the overall understanding, verification, and validation of motor systems for aircraft. Your expertise in aerospace standards, supplier management, and knowledge of electronics and embedded software development will contribute to the successful development of advanced motor systems.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams to gain a comprehensive understanding of motor systems, including electrical, mechanical, and software components, within the aerospace context.
 * Define and establish system-level requirements, ensuring compliance with aerospace standards and customer specifications.
 * Lead the verification and validation activities for motor systems, including developing test plans, conducting testing, and analyzing test data to ensure system performance and safety.
 * Coordinate with external suppliers to manage the development and integration of motor components, ensuring alignment with program milestones and quality standards.
 * Conduct detailed technical reviews of supplier documents, such as requirement specifications, design descriptions, and test procedures.
 * Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify and resolve system-level issues and challenges, applying sound engineering principles and practices.
 * Contribute to the development and improvement of system engineering processes, methodologies, and tools, with a focus on motor systems for aerospace applications.
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in aerospace standards, regulations, and industry best practices, applying them to enhance motor system development.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
 * At least 5 year of experience in system engineering within the aerospace industry, specifically in motor development.
 * In-depth knowledge of aerospace standards and regulations (e.g., ARP4754A), with a focus on motor systems.
 * Experience in verification and validation activities for safety-critical systems, preferably within the aerospace domain.
 * Familiarity with supplier management, including managing external suppliers and ensuring their adherence to program requirements.
 * Knowledge of electronics and embedded software development for motor systems, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex systems and propose innovative solutions.
 * Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate and present technical information to diverse stakeholders.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience in motor design and analysis, including electrical and mechanical aspects.
 * Familiarity with model-based systems engineering methodologies and tools.
 * Knowledge of aerospace hardware development processes and quality standards, including DO-178 and DO-254.
 * Understanding of safety assessment methodologies such as FMEA and FTA.
 * Proficiency in using requirements management tools (e.g., DOORS) and configuration management tools.
 * Experience with system-level integration and testing of motor systems for aircraft.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package

title: Senior Consultant (gn) SAP Validation
description:
Wir digitalisieren die GxP Compliance in der IT!




Aufgrund unserer langjährigen Expertise bei zahlreichen namhaften Unternehmen ist die DHC die #1 bei der Validierung von (ERP-)Systemen. Mit nachhaltig erprobten Methoden, fundierten System-, Prozess- und GxP Compliance-Kenntnissen, in Kombination mit innovativen Technologien, ist die DHC der bevorzugte Validierungspartner.




Gemeinsam gestalten wir die Arbeitswelt von morgen: unsere Vision liegt in der KI-gestützten Automatisierung standardisierter GxP Compliance-Prozesse - von der Erstellung relevanter Dokumente, über elektronische Signaturen bis hin zum automatisierten Testen.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und starte zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt an unserem Standort Saarbrücken durch als




Senior Consultant (gn) SAP Validation







Dein Job




Als Senior Consultant liegt der Erfolg der Projekte unserer Kunden aus dem regulierten Umfeld der Pharma- und Medizintechnikbranche in Deiner Verantwortung. Nach einem professionellen und zielgerichteten Onboarding übernimmst und verantwortest Du sukzessive SAP-Validierungsprojekte. Du unterstützt unsere Kunden u.a. bei der Konzeption und Implementierung von individuellen Validierungsprojekten oder übernimmst unterschiedliche Aufgabenpakete aus dem Bereich der IT-QA. Du bist dafür verantwortlich, dass die Projektdurchführung und das Projektergebnis unseren Standards, den Anforderungen des Kunden und den gesetzlichen Regularien entsprechen.




Deine Skills

 * Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (Bachelor, Master, Diplom bzw. Promotion), idealerweise im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder eine Ausbildung mit relevanter Berufserfahrung.
 * Drei bis fünf Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung, idealerweise als (Teil-)Projektleitung.
 * Sehr gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit den gesetzlichen Regularien und Behördenstandards der Branche.
 * Umfangreiche SAP-Kenntnisse in den gängigen SAP-Lösungen, wie SAP S/4HANA, SAP Cloud-ALM.
 * Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und gutes Englisch.
 * Projektbezogene Reisebereitschaft.




Deine Perspektive

 * Abwechslungsreiche und spannende Projekte innerhalb unserer Projektteams, unter Einsatz der neusten Technologien im regulierten Umfeld der Life Sciences.
 * Ein sicherer Job, welcher zu dir und deinem Leben passt (Vertrauensarbeitszeit, Homeoffice und flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell (von 50%-100% ist jedes Modell möglich).
 * Individuell zugeschnittene Einarbeitung.
 * Eine flache Hierarchie und ein offenes Miteinander.
 * Eine ansprechende Gehaltsstruktur mit diversen Benefits.







Wir freuen uns auf Dich!




Alles auf einen Blick




 * Teilzeit (50% - 99%), Vollzeit (100%)
 * Deutschland (Hybrid), Saarbrücken
 * ab sofort, unbefristet




Dein Ansprechpartner

Jana Schäfer

People Management

title: Verification Engineer
description:
About the Role




In this role you are responsible for system level and integration verification of the designs, as they are produced by the RTL design team. You will also have to provide feedback during the architecture exploration process for future generation designs. You will work on SOC level designs, within a multi-power domain, and will be responsible for building our verification architecture.







What you will do:




 * Verification of low power, multi clock domain designs
 * Work on advanced technology nodes
 * Help RTL designers with module level functional verification
 * Verification of SOC level design
 * Develop the verification infrastructure







What you should bring in:




 * Willingness to learn new, potentially unconventional, technologies/techniques
 * Experience in verification of multi clock domain designs
 * Some experience in working with mixed signal systems
 * Experience developing the verification infrastructure for SOC designs
 * Experience with UVM
 * Advanced level in Python & GIT







Helpful but not required:




 * Experience with the Chisel hardware design language
 * Experience in working with designs beyond the standard cell libraries

title: Requirements Manager

title: REQUIREMENTS MANAGER (M/F/D)
description:
The 4ACES GmbH from Wolfsburg stands for a combination of technology and consulting. We develop creative and innovative solutions for several of our clients’ problem areas and follow an integral advisory approach. We have a communicative team, offer flat hierarchies, flexible work times, and enable every employee to work independently and take on responsibility.

Your tasks

Our projects and areas of responsibility are diverse and varied. On the one hand, you will be involved in ongoing projects, on the other hand will have the chance to be independently responsible for new projects, all the while staying in direct contact with our clients. Within the project team, you will take over the analysis and technical evaluation of complex customer requirements in the automotive area (e.g. Power Electronics), derive specific product requirements (usually corresponding with A-SPICE), and actively support the technical department with the generation of new requirements (UX-perspective) and the evaluation of their potential effects. The participation in various technical alignments is as much part of your daily job as the presentation of new requirements withing the framework of Change Control Boards, and the preparation of decision templates. Ultimately, you are responsible for guaranteeing the reliability and validity of the requirements.

Your Profile

Besides your finished high school education with a technical background (Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Vehicle Technology, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business Information Technology etc.), we are looking for individuals with a customer focus and strong communication skills. As an ideal applicant, you possess the passion for our key topics: Autonomous Driving, Connectivity, Electric Drive, and Shared Mobility. You can quickly learn to analyze new structures and processes, and you implement your knowledge to solve issues with complex problems. You´re at home within a technical environment, you want to include your knowledge in our projects, and you are able to present that knowledge on every level of business hierarchy, including to people with a non-technical background. Ideally, you have already gained experience in Requirements Engineering and Automotive Requirements Process (e.g. A-SPICE, ASIL) and are familiar with software development processes, testing processes, but also with IBM Rational DOORS, IBM Rational Synergy, CANape and EXAM. Initial experiences in the development of steering systems are an advantage.

Our offer

We offer a position within a professional team which has years of experience in the industry. Flat hierarchies and communication on equal terms are self-evident, as well as a good salary. On top of that, you will get the opportunity to grow your skills and yourself while working on interdisciplinary projects (We offer advanced trainings regularly). Because of our regional organization structure, it is possible to avoid long business trips if you wish. Flexible work times and the opportunity to handle your business day how you see fit are a great opportunity to arrange your work life and private life the way you want. Your work-life balance and personal development are important to us.

Job site

Braunschweig

Are you interested in joining a growing and innovative team and to perform in a motivating atmosphere for the future of 4ACES? We would like to see your convincing application. Please also add the earliest start date and your salary expectation.

Apply now

title: Senior Software Requirements Manager (all gender)
description:
Company Description

ALTEN is wherever technology comes to life. You too? Great, then we are looking for you as part of our software team, our Software Delivery Center (SDC) in Coburg.

Innovative start-up culture in large corporations is not possible? It's possible! With ALTEN as the world's leading engineering service provider and IT services partner.

We develop innovative software for our customers, especially from the automotive and aerospace industries, from architecture to testing and validation.

With us, you will work on a wide range of software solutions for a world with a future. To be more precise, this means a highly varied field of tasks, a variety of projects and opportunities for further training. You will focus on development in the automotive (AUTOSAR, e-mobility, autonomous driving, infotainment, connectivity) or aerospace sectors, among others, and thus help shape the future in a strong group. Would you like to work in a motivated team that works according to agile principles? Would you like to help write the next chapter?

Job Description

YOU...


 * work on various projects for different customers in the defence and automotive sectors
 * take over the technical project management (SW requirements/specifications)
 * analyze regulatory and military requirements and define the technical specifications from them
 * define technical concepts, as well as the structure of components and interfaces
 * deal with conflicting demands from stakeholders
 * organize and moderate workshops on specification and requirements analysis
 * proactively cooperate with project management
   
   

Qualifications

YOU…


 * have a degree in computer science or a comparable degree
 * have professional experience in SW Requirements Management and System Engineering and, ideally, in the development of software applications
 * have experience in technical management
 * know IREB and INCOSE methods
 * are familiar with Jama and you know AM and ALM tools (e.g. DOORS, Codebeamer, Polarion)
 * ideally have knowledge of Classic AUTOSAR, ISO 26262 (Functional Safety), ISO 21434 (Cybersecurity), ASPICE
 * are very good in German and English
   
   

We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications – regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age and sexual orientation and identity.

Severely disabled persons will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified.

Do you have any questions?

Then contact me: Dr. Liesa Weber (Tel.: +49 89 255552-266)

Or apply now using our online application form.

Additional Information

 * Work life balance –flexible working hours and mobile working possible
 * Fit and relaxed –with EGYM Wellpass
 * Enjoy biking –always on tour with bike leasing
 * Green Mobility– with us you can travel at a reduced rate
   
   

…and of course we offer the usual standards such as 28 days’ holiday, many events, permanent employment contract and corporate benefits.

description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

ALTEN ist überall dort, wo Technologie zum Leben erweckt wird.Du auch? Großartig, dann suchen wir genau Dich als Teil unseres Software Teams, unserem Software Delivery Center (SDC) in Coburg.

Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion / Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität.

title: Regional Product Owner - Charging
description:
We are searching intelligent and innovative employees. If you are interested in working for a dynamic company with flat hierarchy, we look forward to receiving your application.

title: Computer System Engineer
description:
When you join the Cambridge team, you are part of a skilled and talented global community that is united by a set of core values: commitment, integrity, and perseverance. Join our team and help us confront today’s most threatening and complex obstacles!

Cambridge International Systems, Inc. has a full-time Computer System Engineer opportunity available based inStuttgart, Germany.

Qualified candidates for this job must possess a current DoD Secret security clearance and be eligible for DoD Top Secret clearance, NATO Indoctrination, and meet TESA accreditation requirements. ***TESA Certification allows employees the to be tax exempt for both Germany and US, in addition to other great perks***

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Employees may be eligible for: relocation reimbursement, housing allowance, COLA and school reimbursement for dependents.

ROLE RESPONSIBILTIES

Design and develop solutions to complex applications problems, system administration issues, or network concerns. Perform systems management and integration functions.

Required Qualifications


 * Possesses and applies a comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments.
 * Plans and leads major technology assignments.
 * Evaluates performance results and recommends major changes affecting short-term project growth and success.
 * Functions as a technical expert across multiple project assignments.
 * May supervise others
 * Education and Experience requirements: High School Diploma with 11 years of recent, specialized experience. Associates Degree with 7 years of recent, specialized experience. Major Certification with7 years of recent, specialized experience. Bachelor's Degree (and higher) with 3 years of recent, specialist experience
 * Must be proficient in using different technologies such as computers and other tools and systems pertinent to the position
 * Must possess an active DoD Secret security clearance
   
   

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS


 * Active Passport
 * In rare occasions, overnight travel may be required
   
   

PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT AND WORKING CONDITIONS

Cambridge International Systems complies with Temporary Duty Station (TDY)/Outside Continental United States (OCONUS) vaccination requirements. If this position requires OCONUS travel (listed above), Vaccine Recommendations by AOR | Health.mil lists applicable current vaccination requirements by location.

Office setting:


 * Must be able to work in an office environment, sitting at a desk, looking at a computer for most of the workday
 * Work is physically comfortable; the employee has discretion about sitting, walking, standing, etc
 * May be required to travel short distances to offices/conference rooms and buildings on site.
   
   

BENEFITS AND PERKS

Cambridge International Systems is committed to investing in our employees and their future by providing them with competitive compensation, career development opportunities, comfortable working conditions, and a comprehensive benefits package, some of which are listed below:


 * Medical, dental, vision, Life/AD&D/STD/LTD insurance
 * 401(k) matching and immediate vesting
 * Paid time off and holidays
 * Generous tuition & training assistance program
 * Relocation assistance
 * Sign-on bonuses
 * Referral bonuses
 * Performance-based bonuses
 * Community involvement & outreach
 * Wellness program
 * Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
 * Tickets at Work
   
   

Refer to a friend

If you know someone who may be interested, please share this posting. We are a growing team and there may be more opportunities like this one here at Cambridge International Systems!

More About Us

At Cambridge, we recognize innovation and agility grow through diverse collaboration. Our team is comprised of unique individuals, and it is our policy to provide equal opportunity in recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting individuals in all job categories without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected class or category as may be defined by federal, state, or local laws or regulations. title: System Engineer
description:
IKOS ist das führende europäische Beratungsunternehmen im Bereich der Eisenbahntechnik. Wir engagieren uns für den ökologischen Wandel und die Entwicklung sicherer und langlebiger Transportmittel der Zukunft.




Hintergrund zu den Projekten:

Um das Wachstum von IKOS in Deutschland weiter voranzutreiben, suchen wir System Engineers mit einschlägiger Erfahrung in den Bereichen Rolling Stock und / oder Signaling




Zuständigkeiten:

 * Anforderungsmanagement und Erstellung von Spezifikationen mechatronischer Systeme
 * Mitwirkung bei der elektrischen und funktionalen Integration von Subsystemen
 * Planung von Tests und Unterstützung bei der Testdurchführung
 * Mitarbeit bei Nachweisführung, Verifikation & Validierung
 * Mitarbeit in der Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung funktionaler Zusammenhänge in Simulationsumgebungen
 * Unterstützung bei Sicherheitsanalysen und der Zulassung
 * Begleitung und Unterstützung bei Produkt- und Systemtests




Eine Bewerbung sehen wir gern bei folgenden Vorraussetzungen:

 * Ein abgeschlossenes Ingenieurstudium (Diplom, Bachelor oder Master) - obligatorisch

 * mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Definieren und Ableiten von System Spezifikationen für Rolling Stock (TCMS, Bremsen, Pantograph ... ) oder Signaling-Systeme (Stellwerke, LST ... )
 * Kenntnisse in IBM DOORS oder ähnlichen Tools
 * Deutsch flüssig in Wort und Schrift
 * Bereitschaft für Geschäftsreisen innerhalb von Deutschland




Unsere Werte:

 * Leidenschaft: Unsere Begeisterung für neue Technologien und kontinuierliche Innovation treibt die tägliche Arbeit unserer Projekteams an
 * Respekt: Vertrauen und gegenseitige Wertschätzung, verbunden mit Gleichberechtigung und Vielfalt, ermöglichen es uns, unsere Zukunft gemeinsam zu gestalten
 * Teamgeist: Dieser Wert ist von grundlegender Bedeutung für unser Berufsverständnis. Er ermöglicht es uns, mit unserem einzigartigen Team sowohl Groß- als auch Hightech-Projekte zu realisieren.
 * Exzellenz: Die Lösung der gesellschaftlichen Herausforderungen im Verkehrswesen erfordert und verdient das Beste von uns. Gestärkt durch unsere Überzeugungen bleibt Exzellenz das Herzstück unserer Arbeit.




Get on the right Track! 🚆




Bei uns spielen Sie eine aktive Rolle bei der Nachhaltigkeit durch die Weiterentwicklung von Technologien im Verkehrswesen für eine grünere Zukunft!

Wir danken allen Bewerber*innen für ihr Interesse, werden aber nur mit denjenigen in Kontakt treten, die in Frage kommen.

title: Senior System Engineer
description:

Are you an experienced IT professional with a passion for Microsoft technologies and a flair for problem-solving? Join a leading IT services provider in Germany, specializing in innovative and secure solutions for public sector clients.

title: System Engineer
description:
The Role

The Systems Engineer is part of the engineering team that develops marine navigation and bridge systems for OSI’s government and naval markets. The Systems Engineer plays a critical role in the development of the overall system requirements’ design and definition for OSI’s complex products. With offices globally, OSI Maritime Systems are now opening in Kiel, Germany. This role will be a part of the growth of this office.




Key Responsibilities

 * Assists senior engineers in developing design concepts and generates technical proposal material in response to Request for Quotation (RFQ)
 * Develops system designs, performs functional analysis, defines systems architecture, defines interfaces and specification, performs trade-studies and documents the design by writing SSDD, ICDs, SRS
 * Performs requirement analysis, traceability and maintenance of requirements
 * Coordinates design of subsystems and integration of total system
 * Identifies, analyzes and resolves program support deficiencies
 * Develops and recommends corrective actions
 * Designs to government standards, including Military and IMO standards, ensuring ongoing compliance and adherence to requirements
 * Ensures availability, reliability and other logistics support considerations are part of the system design process
 * Reviews obsolescence issues and recommends design changes
 * Attends and participates in customer design reviews and acceptance events
 * May participate in system integration tests, trials, and acceptance tests at customer facilities
 * Writes acceptance test procedures
 * Manages scope of work, schedules work, estimates effort and costs, and identifies technical risks; effectively communicates status on a regular basis to management




Qualifications

 * Degree in Engineering or Physics, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience
 * 4 years’ engineering experience, Minimum 3 years’ experience in Systems Engineering;
 * Experience in marine electronics and integrated bridge systems a significant asset; experience in defense or government domain preferably in naval ship sector a significant asset
 * Strong knowledge of marine navigation and tactical sensors or systems;
 * Excellent knowledge of Systems Engineering principles, standards and best practices;
 * Familiarity with requirements and verification management tools such as DOORS;
sector: Defense and Space Manufacturing and Maritime Transportation

title: System Engineer / Network Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
System Engineer | Network Engineer (m/f/d)

Karlsruhe INIT GmbH

Your First Insight

If you are a computer specialist with a passion, then you can set the digital course with us as a System Engineer | Network Engineer (m/f/d) so that our hardware and software solutions work in our customers' IT infrastructures all over the world. Our 10-strong team in the heart of Karlsruhe creates the technical basis for our customer projects and we need reinforcements for this.

What You Can Expect

Your core tasks are the provision and support of IT infrastructures in our national and international customer projects for sustainable local public transport. You act as an integrator between the various specialist departments within INIT and form the fundamental interface between hardware and software.

Here Is An Insight Into Your Tasks


 * In coordination with our technical project teams and our customers, you will take care of the provision of the required resources (on-premise, virtual and in the cloud)
 * Among other things, you set up network and security infrastructures, virtualization platforms, Active Directory and configure operating systems and services in this context
 * Monitoring and carrying out 2nd / 3rd level error analyses and troubleshooting in cooperation with our development department are part of your job
 * As part of your role, you will work on the creation of our technical concepts and documentation for our worldwide tenders
 * You continuously eliminate vulnerabilities and support the further development of our customers' infrastructures and their services as the basis for a sustainable and secure INIT system
 * It is important to you to contribute your technical knowledge and expand it together with us - then you've come to the right place!
   
   

What You Bring With You


 * You have completed an apprenticeship, further training, a similar technical degree (with a focus on IT) or can demonstrate relevant professional experience
 * Good skills in dealing with hardware as well as network and storage technologies
 * Good knowledge in the administration of operating systems (Microsoft and Linux) as well as basics in virtualized environments (VMware, Hyper-V) and their data security (e.g. Veeam and Symantec)
 * Experience with cloud technologies would be ideal!
 * You enjoy occasional customer visits to experience the results of your work live on site
 * You communicate confidently in German and English and show initiative - if you speak other languages such as French, great, but this is not a must
   
   

If you don't have in-depth experience in every area, we still look forward to receiving your application!

See for yourself and become a part of INIT - we look forward to hearing from you!

Your Benefits With Us Include


 * Flexible working hours and mobile office option
 * 30 days of vacation and the option of 5 additional days of "flexi vacation"
 * Gaming zone, massage chair and creative area
 * Additional financial benefits for travel costs and childcare, among other things
 * Up-to-date smartphone (Android/iOS) for professional & private use
   
   

What happens after your application?

After your application, we will review your documents as quickly as possible. The next step is for us to get to know each other in a telephone or digital interview. We will then invite you on site so that you can get to know the potential workplace and some of the team members.

Induction & teamwork are important to us! During your induction, an exclusive "mentor" will be on hand with help and advice. In addition, you can always rely on your team. In this way, you will gradually get to know INIT, our technologies and our work.

Shaping the Future of Mobility - together! Together, we are making an important contribution to the future of mobility and shaping the public transport of tomorrow. Sounds interesting? Find out more on our homepage - www.initse.com.

Any questions?

If you have any questions, we are happy to help and can be reached at jobs@initse.com or +49 721 6100-0!

Marco Emanuele

HR Recruiter

www.initse.com

    * Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement

 * Sie verfügen über eine methodische, analytische und selbständige Arbeitsweise, sind regional reisebereit und besitzen sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse. Eine ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung, Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Organisationsgeschick runden Ihr Profil ab.
   

Benefits


 * attraktives, leistungsbezogenes Gehaltsmodell
 * unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
 * umfassende Angebote zur Weiterbildung und individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
 * offene und vertrauensvolle Arbeitsatmosphäre
 * Firmenfahrzeug mit der Möglichkeit der Privatnutzung
 * flexible Arbeitszeiten
 * regelmäßig stattfindende Personal- und Feedbackgespräche
 * kurze Entscheidungswege
 * strukturierte Einarbeitung
 * betriebliche Altersvorsorge
 * Job-Fahrrad
   
   

Über uns

Unsere Vision: Den Arbeitsalltag von Unternehmen und deren Mitarbeiter*innen effektiv, mühelos und sicher mithilfe von zukunftsorientierten IT-Lösungen zu gestalten.

NetPlans wurde 1998 gegründet und steht heute für professionelle und ISO-zertifizierte Cloud- und Infrastruktur-Lösungen, die speziell auf die Anforderungen von mittelständischen Unternehmen zugeschnitten sind. Aktuell arbeiten bei NetPlans rund 400 Mitarbeiter*innen an elf Standorten.

Durch unsere Kundennähe entstehen vertrauensvolle und partnerschaftliche Beziehungen. Wir wollen unsere Kunden zuerst verstehen und dann beraten, um eine langfristige Kundenzufriedenheit zu erreichen.

Der wertschätzende Umgang miteinander ist uns jederzeit sehr wichtig und unsere Unternehmenskultur stellt schon immer unsere Mitarbeiter*innen in den Mittelpunkt. Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitern*innen, fördern aktiv deren Potenziale und wollen, dass unsere Mitarbeiter*innen ihre eigenen Stärken optimal einbringen können und sich bei NetPlans wohlfühlen.

title: IT System Engineer
description:
Our satellite ground systems are valued by our customers for their reliability and performance. The "Project IT" team designs these systems and is responsible for the regular maintenance, care and regeneration of the components and continuous further development. We are looking for you to operate and constantly improve our systems. As an IT systems engineer, you are instrumental in our success!

Your tasks


 * As an IT systems engineer, you will be responsible for the implementation of IT projects in the field of satellite ground systems
 * As a technical manager, you communicate with internal and external stakeholders
 * You will create tasks for the IT system specialists and IT operations and ensure the implementation
 * Technical challenges appeal to their ambition and spirit of research
 * You design IT systems to meet customer requirements
 * You will ensure compatibility with the technical interfaces in the project
 * You will be in direct contact with the project management and draw up schedules for the implementation of the IT system
 * You will advise on the technologies used, drawing on the expertise of IT specialists
 * You will support new projects and proposal teams in the design phase and translate project requirements into IT infrastructure requirements
 * You will support the test team in carrying out tests in the implementation phase
 * In addition, you can take on the responsibility of being a service owner
 * They ensure the quality of the documents requested in the project
   
   

Your Qualifications


 * You have a degree with a focus on IT and several years of professional experience in the project environment or a comparable qualification
 * You have a broad interest in IT and technology and are an expert in at least one subject area
 * You are familiar with common processes and products for project and IT service management (ITIL, Jira, Confluence, MS Project)
 * You can motivate employees and instruct them professionally
 * You have an overview of complex relationships in the project and can present them
 * You have a high sense of responsibility
 * You like to communicate in a solution-oriented, convincing and friendly manner
 * Knowledge of Jira, MS Project, i-doit and the Office components is desirable
 * You have written and spoken German and English skills
 * They are not perfect! Together, we want to further promote your professional development

title: IT System Engineer (w/m/d)
description:
Werde Teil unseres crossfunktionalen Teams!

Wofür wir dich suchen

Als IT System Engineer (w/m/d) mit der Fokussierung auf unsere Middleware und Cloud Technologien bei der X-INTEGRATE sorgst du als Teil eines Teams aus Software Infrastruktur und Cloud Experten für die Bereitstellung von modernen Software Lösungen als Grundlage für die Realisierung der Projekte unserer Kunden. Dabei geht es nicht nur um die initiale Konzeption und Realisierung, sondern vor Allem auch um die stetige Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung der Plattformen.

Die interessante Mischung aus Projekttätigkeiten und operativem Betrieb stellt dabei die optimale Grundlage dar sich technologisch und methodisch weiterzubilden und das Wissen in der täglichen Praxis anzuwenden. Wir arbeiten interdisziplinär und agil und suchen stets nach der optimalen Lösung für unsere Kunden.

Was du bei uns bewegst


 * Du entwickelst und betreust Integrations- und Prozessautomationsplattformen in komplexen und hybriden Enterprise Umgebungen unserer Kunden
 * Du unterstützt hierbei vom Design der Lösungsarchitektur, über den Aufbau und die Konfiguration der Komponenten bis hin zum Betrieb der Lösung den gesamten Lösungszyklus in spannenden Projekten
 * Dabei ist die Inbetriebnahme für dich nur der Startpunkt für eine kontinuierliche, betriebliche Betreuung und stetige Optimierung
 * Der stetige Austausch unseren agilen und crossfunktionalen Entwicklungsteams und natürlich den Auftraggebern ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil deiner Arbeit
 * Du setzt dabei je nach Kundenbedürfnis führende Technologie Stacks (z.B. Kubernetes, elastic, redis) und diverse Cloud Hyperscaler (z.B. OpenShift, AWS, Azure) ein
 * Vor dem Hintergrund der betrieblichen Anforderungen setzt du dich auch mit den klassischen ITIL-Disziplinen für Incident, Service Request, Problem und Change Management auseinander
   
   

Was du mitbringst


 * Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium (Informatik oder Naturwissenschaft) oder eine Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker Systemintegration
 * Deine fundierten Erfahrung im Bereich Administration gängiger Betriebssysteme (Unix, Linux, Windows) und idealerweise Kenntnisse im Mainframe-Umfeld
 * Du bist routiniert im Scripting mit beispielsweise PowerShell, Python oder Shell
 * Sofern Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Release Management, Build- und Release-Pipelines, Artifact Managements vorhanden sind, kannst du diese bei uns ebenfalls einbringen und weiterentwickeln
 * Grundlegende Kenntnisse im Bereich Cloud Infrastrukturen (z.B. Azure oder AWS) runden dein Profil ab
 * Deine gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit und die Freude an der Zusammenarbeit im Team
   
   

Was wir dir bieten

Womit Wir Dir Einen Echten Mehrwert Bieten


 * Workation bietet dir die Möglichkeit für eine gewisse Zeit mobil aus dem EU-Ausland oder den EFTA-Staaten (Island, Liechtenstein, Norwegen, Schweiz) zu arbeiten
 * Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Berufsunfähigkeitsversicherung bieten den Rahmen für deine Vorsorge
 * Möglichkeiten wie z.B. Jobrad, Jobticket/Klimaticket oder ein Firmenwagen sorgen für deine Mobilität
 * Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement sowie die Bezuschussung von Sportangeboten wie z.B. URBAN SPORTS CLUB und Just Fit helfen dir gesund und aktiv zu sein
 * Deine Empfehlungen honorieren wir mit einer Prämie (Mitarbeitenden-Empfehlungsprogramm)
 * Durch legendäre Afterwork Events wie Cocktailabend, Kicker-Turnier, Hackathon lernst du uns besser kennen
   
   

Was für uns selbstverständlich ist und Ausdruck unserer WIR-Kultur:


 * Mobiles und flexibles Arbeiten sorgt für deine optimale Work-Life Integration
 * Regelmäßige Aus- und Weiterbildungen und Förderung individueller Zertifizierungen bringen dich weiter
 * 30 Tage Urlaub, Sonderurlaub und individuelle Sabbatical Regelungen bieten dir Auszeit und Entspannung
 * Die Hardware kannst du auch für private Zwecke nutzen
 * Softgetränke sowie Kaffee und Tee kriegst du bei uns kostenlos
 * Großartige Firmenevents machen unsere Kultur für dich erlebbar
   
   

*Die abgebildeten Leistungen können je nach Unternehmen, Standort und Land leicht variieren.

Über uns

Wir, die X-INTEGRATE Software & Consulting GmbH, helfen digitalisierenden Unternehmen, deren Geschäftsprozesse durch Automatisierung zu optimieren und neue Geschäftsmodelle mit innovativer Technologie zu unterstützen, indem wir heterogene Datenbestände und Applikationen integrieren, die Geschäftsabläufe mit Prozessmethoden analysieren und mit technischen Workflows automatisieren sowie die Geschäftsentscheidungen mittels Data Science vorzubereiten oder zu automatisieren.

Zur TIMETOACT GROUP gehören die IT-Unternehmen ARS, brainbits, catworkx, CLOUDPILOTS, IPG, novaCapta, PKS, synaigy, TIMETOACT, Walldorf Consulting und X-INTEGRATE. Zusammen beschäftigen wir 1300 Mitarbeitende in 22 Städten in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz sowie an Service Hubs in Lettland, Malaysia, Singapur und der Ukraine. Ein weiterer Sales Hub befindet sich in den USA. Als TIMETOACT GROUP modernisieren und integrieren wir IT-Anwendungen für unsere Kunden, um deren Agilität, Effizienz und Transparenz zu steigern sowie Kosten und Risiken zu senken. Für innovative Kunden gestalten und implementieren wir darüber hinaus digitale Business Modelle, die neue Marktchancen eröffnen.

Geschlecht, Herkunft, sexuelle Orientierung, Alter und religiöse Ausrichtung spielen bei uns keine Rolle – wichtig sind uns stattdessen das funktionierende Team, gegenseitiger Respekt, Wertschätzung, sowie Motivation und Spaß an der Arbeit.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung über unser Onlineformular. So erreichen deine Unterlagen direkt die richtige Ansprechperson. Bewerbungsunterlagen in Papierform können wir leider nicht zurücksenden.

title: System Engineer - Connectivity & IoT (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

The purpose of this role is to ensure that the design of the system aligns with overall business objectives, regulatory requirements, and industry standards. The strategic contribution of this role is to ensure that the designed system maximizes value to the company and can be operated efficiently and effectively during its product lifecycle.


 * You will create architecture concepts for integration of various systems
 * You will manage functional and physical integration of systems on aircraft and ground segments
 * You will define and manage hardware and software interfaces
 * You will perform and review requirements decomposition
 * You will support functional decompositions to define aircraft and system functions
 * You will coordinate between multiple stakeholders, internal and external to Volocopter, for the success of our projects
 * You will adapt systems engineering in a pragmatic way to support team objectives and fast development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or similar
 * 3+ years of experience in hardware engineering and firmware development, with a focus on avionics systems
 * Strong understanding of UAS and support system functions and systems design
 * Strong understanding of avionics systems, including system-level design, integration, and testing
 * Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
 * Experience in writing and managing requirements
 * Knowledge of regulatory and certification requirements for aviation products, such as RTCA/DO-178, RTCA/DO-254, and ARINC-429 as well as ARINC-825 beneficial
 * Knowledge of the following tools is highly beneficial: Windchill RV&S, Systems Modeling Language (SysML), Unified Modeling Language (UML), Capella, Basic CAD skills
 * Drone piloting experience is beneficial along with pilot license and radio license
 * The following soft skills are highly beneficial:
    * Excellent teamwork communication and collaboration skills,
    * Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment,
    * Ability to manage varied tasks and prioritize workload,
    * Ability to work methodically in a fast-paced environment with evolving priorities.
      

Additional Information

Our Volocopter flight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity at Volocopter:

Our differences are what make us great. Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential.

title: System Engineer (Data center) [gn]
description:
Your role

At LUMASERV you will manage and oversee our infrastructure running our customers products, serving millions of users every day.

This role involves the operational management of host systems, our routing, switching and storage infrastructure as well as the hardware within our datacenter using latest technologies.

A deep understanding of cloud technologies, network management and datacenter center operations along with a proactive approach to system maintenance and enhancement is required.

You will have the ability to hire and work with your own team supported by our leadership team. Therefore this role requires a combination of technical expertise and leadership skills.

Your todos


 * Ensuring a stable service of network and cloud hypervisors
 * System maintenance, optimisation and extension
 * Patch management
 * Implementation and extension of monitoring tools
 * Building up a team of fellow system engineers
   
   

Your Skills


 * Deep understanding of networks (including switching and routing), on prem infrastructures, host systems, virtualisations, datacenter hardware and CEPH storage solutions
 * Experience in managing network infrastructure as well as maintaining infrastructure for more than 1000 Linux based VMs
 * Knowledge in cloud technologies as well as maintaining infrastructure in public cloud environments
 * Skills in implementing and using monitoring tools for early detection and resolution of system issues
 * Knowledge of IT security standards and compliance requirements
 * Ability to plan, coordinate and successful execution of complex projects
   
   

Your Benefits

Founded in 2015 we are a young team of highly talented software- and system engineers in our office located in Koblenz, Germany. We like our team and working with each other.


 * Devices of your choice (MacBook, iPhone, Windows)
 * Company car (possible)
 * Flexible work time (you can choose your schedule, working from abroad while traveling possible)
 * Exciting Company-wide events at least once per quarter
 * Flexible monthly budget for educational resources, conferences and training
 * Office located in a beautiful location right next to the university, the Moselle river and a wonderful beach. Parking lots are available onsite and the bus stop is less than 150m away (connected very well to the ÖPNV)
 * Drinks, coffee and gaming area
   
   

Requirements

Being located in Germany is required for this position. Due the amount of applications we receive, we do not reply to application not fulfilling this requirement.

About Us

LUMASERV empowers clients to gain access to compliant cloud services without effort. We work with companies and government institutions to elevate their services and infrastructure. Each day, millions of end-users place their trust in our expertise.

Do you seek an engaging professional environment that values individual contributions, encourages ownership, and offers autonomy in project work? LUMASERV is your ideal destination. Say goodbye to corporate boredom and take the opportunity to work in a team where skills and achievements are recognised and celebrated.

Join us at LUMASERV, where your professional journey will be both exciting and rewarding.

title: Linux System Engineer
