We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Junior Engineer - Golang & Distributed Systems
description:
BUILD THE NEXT GENERATION OF THE INTERNET

Impossible Cloud is a B2B cloud platform with a focus on becoming the #1 cloud platform in Europe and beyond. It was founded by serial entrepreneurs who have previously built a billion-euro tech company.

Currently, our offering includes cloud object storage similar to AWS S3, and our market success is already being proven by highly promising growth based on our channel-based GTM strategy. While we build a comprehensive suite of cloud products, we are redefining the cloud sector by bridging the gap between decentralized infrastructure (DePIN) and mainstream B2B cloud use cases.

Become part of something bigger: We’re committed to reinventing the internet and push technological innovation and business determination to the next level.

Your Impact

Join our team and grow your skills while helping us build a robust, distributed cloud application! You’ll get hands-on experience with modern distributed systems and learn how to make decentralized storage and computing secure and efficient at scale.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL


 * Assist in the design, development, and implementation of distributed systems, primarily using Go
 * Collaborate with experienced engineers to set up scalable data structures, storage, and computing architecture
 * Contribute to developing systems that serve data to users worldwide with low latency
 * Help maintain and scale production software, learning best practices in reliability and performance
 * Write clean, well-tested code with regular guidance and code reviews
 * Be part of an ambitious startup environment where you’ll grow quickly and make an impact
   
   
   
   
   

YOU COULD BE A GREAT FIT FOR THE ROLE IF YOU HAVE


 * A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
 * Some experience or coursework with Go
 * A basic understanding of cloud infrastructure services and interest in learning more about scalable systems
 * Interest in designing and developing APIs and data streaming systems
 * The ability to work well in a team, communicate effectively, and be open to feedback
 * Curiosity and a strong desire to learn in a fast-paced environment
   
   
   
   
   

BONUS POINTS


 * Basic understanding of cloud platforms and distributed systems concepts
 * Familiarity with networking basics (DNS, HTTP, TCP/IP) or willingness to learn
 * Previous experience with other programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, TypeScript) and a desire to learn Golang
 * Interest in areas like cryptography, cybersecurity, or Web3 technologies
 * Passion for learning from experienced team members and growing your technical skills
   
   
   
   
   

What We Offer


 * Competitive salary coupled with direct engagement in your success through an enticing ESOP and token participation program
 * Ideal company stage with established initial revenue and a distinctive edge in the web3 industry
 * Collaboration with experienced, passionate, and supportive colleagues, leveraging cutting-edge technology
 * Fantastic office situated in a trendy location with access to complimentary healthy brain food and a subsidized premium gym membership
 * Monthly collaborative meet-up weeks featuring team events
   
   
   
   
   

OUR CULTURE

We are committed to success. We embrace individuals from all backgrounds who share the goal of building a future European cloud champion. We place great importance on in-person collaboration and open communication, and we value working together regularly at our Hamburg headquarters. If you are an innovative thinker with a passion for driving success in decentralised technology and the cloud industry, we invite you to apply.

Join a workplace that values your well-being, fosters a vibrant and collaborative atmosphere, and play a key role in shaping the future of the Cloud.

OUR HIRING PROCESS

Application Submission
We encourage you to kickstart your application by submitting your comprehensive LinkedIn profile or CV along with the designated application form.

Kickoff Call for Selected Candidates
Successful candidates will be invited to participate in a Kickoff call, where we aim to explore your qualifications, experiences, and expectations.

Efficient Interview Process
Our commitment is to complete the hiring process in 2 to 4 additional remote and/or on-site steps, according to the specific role and its seniority level.

We believe in moving swiftly to welcome exceptional talent into our dynamic workplace.

title: System Engineer Power Distribution (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative System Engineer Power Distributionto join our team. As a System Engineer Power Distribution, you will be responsible for ensuring that the aircraft's high voltage and low voltage power distribution systems and its components meets functional, performance, certification, and safety requirements. You will play a critical role in authoring and reviewing design data, testing, inspection, and analysis documentation that enables the certification and operation of the Power Distribution System while integrated to its applicable aircraft electrical, mechanical, thermal, and logical interfaces. Your strong communication skills and technical expertise will be essential in driving the Power Distribution System design towards optimal performance and compliance.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Work in close collaboration with other Power Distribution System Engineers to execute tasks pertaining the development of high voltage and low voltage power distribution components such as high voltage power centers, circuit breaker panels, low voltage emergency batteries and overhead HV and LV electrical control panels. The work packages will be distributed between team members of the Power Distribution System Engineers based on team members expertise and project demands; therefore, any team member may work on any development elements of these components and their intra and inter-system interfaces (e.g. high voltage batteries, high voltage battery management system, high voltage electric motors, Avionics display systems, etc).
 * Authors and reviews internal and supplier’s design data (such as requirements specifications and design description documents), testing, inspection and analysis documentation that demonstrates compliance to the applicable system, subsystem and components requirements pertaining the Aircraft’s Power Distribution System.
 * Authors and reviews internal and supplier’s Electrical and Communication Interface Control Documents applicable to the Power Distribution System development.
 * Authors and/or reviews the release of Power Distribution System parts and parts assembly contained in the Aircraft Engineering Bill of Materials.
 * Documents, through the applicable company processes, system-level and components compliances and non-compliances to any requirements including relevant aerospace or equivalent complex system development industry (e.g. land and naval vehicles) standards and regulations, such as SC-VTOL, ARP-4754, DO-254, DO-178 and DO-160.
 * Closely collaborate with the certification engineers to ensure that the Power Distribution System design and development activities meet all necessary certification requirements.
 * Reviews suppliers and partners technical documentation for compliance demonstration and dispositions non-compliances, either accepting or challenging the suppliers based on founded technical background.
 * Supports safety engineers with system understanding for safety assessments including support to review failure modes presented in FMEAs, CMAs and PRAs.
 * Collaborate with the test and verification team to define test plans and ensure successful validation and verification of the electrical design.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
 * Experience in aerospace’s or equivalent complex systems development industry (e.g. land and naval vehicles) electrical system components design and system integration within a complex system integration product.
 * In-depth knowledge of aerospace or equivalent complex systems development industry (e.g. land and naval vehicles) standards and regulations, such as SC-VTOL, ARP-4754, DO-254, DO-178 and DO-160, and their implications to the development of the system components and its integration.
 * Proficiency in requirements management tools such as Integrity, Doors, Polarion and the theoretical Systems Engineering elements that follows, such as requirements capture, rationales, validation and verification methods, registering and processing of non-compliances, etc.
 * Proficiency in maintaining and updating functional breakdown assessments, either introduced or corrected by the system design while giving support to safety engineers on their SFHA.
 * Ability to author and review engineering documents, such as design description documents, test plans/procedures/results, analysis and inspection reports for compliance demonstration.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * In-depth understanding of electrical components for aviation such as HV and LV fuses, HV and LV SSPCs, HV and LV Contactors, HV to LV DC-DC converters, Diodes, Circuit Breakers, Connectors, Studs, etc.
 * Solid functional understanding of electrical magnitudes (voltage, current, power, energy) monitoring systems and methodologies for controlling electrical connection devices.
 * Solid understanding of standards related to high voltage and safety regulations associated to HV components in aerospace, naval or land vehicles.
 * Proficiency in using engineering tools and software for simulation, analysis, and design such as MATLAB, Python.
 * Experience with advanced electrical technologies and emerging trends in the aerospace industry for high voltage and low voltage power distribution.
 * Basic knowledge of communication buses and their logical integration within and outside the electrical power distribution systems.
 * Understanding of system safety assessment engineering principles according to ARP-4761 or equivalent standard.
 * Experience with model-based systems engineering.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System Engineer / Network Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
System Engineer | Network Engineer (m/f/d)

Karlsruhe INIT GmbH

Your First Insight

If you are a computer specialist with a passion, then you can set the digital course with us as a System Engineer | Network Engineer (m/f/d) so that our hardware and software solutions work in our customers' IT infrastructures all over the world. Our 10-strong team in the heart of Karlsruhe creates the technical basis for our customer projects and we need reinforcements for this.

What You Can Expect

Your core tasks are the provision and support of IT infrastructures in our national and international customer projects for sustainable local public transport. You act as an integrator between the various specialist departments within INIT and form the fundamental interface between hardware and software.

Here Is An Insight Into Your Tasks


 * In coordination with our technical project teams and our customers, you will take care of the provision of the required resources (on-premise, virtual and in the cloud)
 * Among other things, you set up network and security infrastructures, virtualization platforms, Active Directory and configure operating systems and services in this context
 * Monitoring and carrying out 2nd / 3rd level error analyses and troubleshooting in cooperation with our development department are part of your job
 * As part of your role, you will work on the creation of our technical concepts and documentation for our worldwide tenders
 * You continuously eliminate vulnerabilities and support the further development of our customers' infrastructures and their services as the basis for a sustainable and secure INIT system
 * It is important to you to contribute your technical knowledge and expand it together with us - then you've come to the right place!
   
   

What You Bring With You


 * You have completed an apprenticeship, further training, a similar technical degree (with a focus on IT) or can demonstrate relevant professional experience
 * Good skills in dealing with hardware as well as network and storage technologies
 * Good knowledge in the administration of operating systems (Microsoft and Linux) as well as basics in virtualized environments (VMware, Hyper-V) and their data security (e.g. Veeam and Symantec)
 * Experience with cloud technologies would be ideal!
 * You enjoy occasional customer visits to experience the results of your work live on site
 * You communicate confidently in German and English and show initiative - if you speak other languages such as French, great, but this is not a must
   
   

If you don't have in-depth experience in every area, we still look forward to receiving your application!

See for yourself and become a part of INIT - we look forward to hearing from you!

Your Benefits With Us Include


 * Flexible working hours and mobile office option
 * 30 days of vacation and the option of 5 additional days of "flexi vacation"
 * Gaming zone, massage chair and creative area
 * Additional financial benefits for travel costs and childcare, among other things
 * Up-to-date smartphone (Android/iOS) for professional & private use
   
   

What happens after your application?

After your application, we will review your documents as quickly as possible. The next step is for us to get to know each other in a telephone or digital interview. We will then invite you on site so that you can get to know the potential workplace and some of the team members.

Induction & teamwork are important to us! During your induction, an exclusive "mentor" will be on hand with help and advice. In addition, you can always rely on your team. In this way, you will gradually get to know INIT, our technologies and our work.

Shaping the Future of Mobility - together! Together, we are making an important contribution to the future of mobility and shaping the public transport of tomorrow. Sounds interesting? Find out more on our homepage - www.initse.com.

Any questions?

If you have any questions, we are happy to help and can be reached at jobs@initse.com or +49 721 6100-0!

Marco Emanuele

HR Recruiter

www.initse.com

title: System Engineer
description:
IKOS ist das führende europäische Beratungsunternehmen im Bereich der Eisenbahntechnik. Wir engagieren uns für den ökologischen Wandel und die Entwicklung sicherer und langlebiger Transportmittel der Zukunft.




Hintergrund zu den Projekten:

Um das Wachstum von IKOS in Deutschland weiter voranzutreiben, suchen wir System Engineers mit einschlägiger Erfahrung in den Bereichen Rolling Stock und / oder Signaling




Zuständigkeiten:

 * Anforderungsmanagement und Erstellung von Spezifikationen mechatronischer Systeme
 * Mitwirkung bei der elektrischen und funktionalen Integration von Subsystemen
 * Planung von Tests und Unterstützung bei der Testdurchführung
 * Mitarbeit bei Nachweisführung, Verifikation & Validierung
 * Mitarbeit in der Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung funktionaler Zusammenhänge in Simulationsumgebungen
 * Unterstützung bei Sicherheitsanalysen und der Zulassung
 * Begleitung und Unterstützung bei Produkt- und Systemtests




Eine Bewerbung sehen wir gern bei folgenden Vorraussetzungen:

 * Ein abgeschlossenes Ingenieurstudium (Diplom, Bachelor oder Master) - obligatorisch
 * Sie besitzen eine Leidenschaft für technische Innovationen und wollen die Zukunft des Schienenverkehrs mitgestalten
 * mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Definieren und Ableiten von System Spezifikationen für Rolling Stock (TCMS, Bremsen, Pantograph ... ) oder Signaling-Systeme (Stellwerke, LST ... )
 * Kenntnisse in IBM DOORS oder ähnlichen Tools
 * Deutsch flüssig in Wort und Schrift
 * Bereitschaft für Geschäftsreisen innerhalb von Deutschland




Unsere Werte:

 * Leidenschaft: Unsere Begeisterung für neue Technologien und kontinuierliche Innovation treibt die tägliche Arbeit unserer Projekteams an
 * Respekt: Vertrauen und gegenseitige Wertschätzung, verbunden mit Gleichberechtigung und Vielfalt, ermöglichen es uns, unsere Zukunft gemeinsam zu gestalten
 * Teamgeist: Dieser Wert ist von grundlegender Bedeutung für unser Berufsverständnis. Er ermöglicht es uns, mit unserem einzigartigen Team sowohl Groß- als auch Hightech-Projekte zu realisieren.
 * Exzellenz: Die Lösung der gesellschaftlichen Herausforderungen im Verkehrswesen erfordert und verdient das Beste von uns. Gestärkt durch unsere Überzeugungen bleibt Exzellenz das Herzstück unserer Arbeit.




Get on the right Track! 🚆




Bei uns spielen Sie eine aktive Rolle bei der Nachhaltigkeit durch die Weiterentwicklung von Technologien im Verkehrswesen für eine grünere Zukunft!

Wir danken allen Bewerber*innen für ihr Interesse, werden aber nur mit denjenigen in Kontakt treten, die in Frage kommen.

title: System Engineer Motor (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated System Engineer to join our team, with a specialized focus on motor development for aerospace applications. As a System Engineer, you will play a key role in the overall understanding, verification, and validation of motor systems for aircraft. Your expertise in aerospace standards, supplier management, and knowledge of electronics and embedded software development will contribute to the successful development of advanced motor systems.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams to gain a comprehensive understanding of motor systems, including electrical, mechanical, and software components, within the aerospace context.
 * Define and establish system-level requirements, ensuring compliance with aerospace standards and customer specifications.
 * Lead the verification and validation activities for motor systems, including developing test plans, conducting testing, and analyzing test data to ensure system performance and safety.
 * Coordinate with external suppliers to manage the development and integration of motor components, ensuring alignment with program milestones and quality standards.
 * Conduct detailed technical reviews of supplier documents, such as requirement specifications, design descriptions, and test procedures.
 * Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify and resolve system-level issues and challenges, applying sound engineering principles and practices.
 * Contribute to the development and improvement of system engineering processes, methodologies, and tools, with a focus on motor systems for aerospace applications.
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in aerospace standards, regulations, and industry best practices, applying them to enhance motor system development.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
 * At least 5 year of experience in system engineering within the aerospace industry, specifically in motor development.
 * In-depth knowledge of aerospace standards and regulations (e.g., ARP4754A), with a focus on motor systems.
 * Experience in verification and validation activities for safety-critical systems, preferably within the aerospace domain.
 * Familiarity with supplier management, including managing external suppliers and ensuring their adherence to program requirements.
 * Knowledge of electronics and embedded software development for motor systems, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex systems and propose innovative solutions.
 * Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate and present technical information to diverse stakeholders.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience in motor design and analysis, including electrical and mechanical aspects.
 * Familiarity with model-based systems engineering methodologies and tools.
 * Knowledge of aerospace hardware development processes and quality standards, including DO-178 and DO-254.
 * Understanding of safety assessment methodologies such as FMEA and FTA.
 * Proficiency in using requirements management tools (e.g., DOORS) and configuration management tools.
 * Experience with system-level integration and testing of motor systems for aircraft.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Systems Engineer - Modern Workplace (All genders)
description:
Company Description

More than 20 years ago, zooplus was one of the first to bring the pet category into the world of eCommerce. Today, we stand strong as Europe’s leading online pet platform, delivering moments of happiness to more than 9 million pet parents each year.

We're on a mission to create joy for pets and their parents, driven by our core values of Care, Courage, Openness, and Simplicity. At the heart of everything we do, they inspire us to grow, raise the bar for our customers and fuel a pet-first business.

Job Description

We’re looking for an innovative and enthusiastic Workplace System Engineer to join our team!

In this role, you’ll have the chance to show your technical skills and creativity while managing workplace services and device management in our environment. If you have 3-5 years of experience and expertise in Intune, Jamf, and scripting, we want to hear from you!

Bonus points if you have experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, and GitHub for version control and collaboration.

As a key member of our IT team, you’ll collaborate with diverse teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions that enhance productivity and user satisfactiodn. If you’re excited about automating processes, leveraging modern tools, and shaping the future of workplace technology, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Key Responsibilities:


 * Design and manage Windows, macOS, and Linux workplace environments.
 * Implement and maintain Microsoft Intune for Windows devices, Jamf for macOS, and Linux management platforms.
 * Manage Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) environments, ensuring seamless integration.
 * Automate device configurations and patch management using PowerShell and Bash.
 * Administer software deployment and security policies via Intune and Jamf.
 * Support M365 services, particularly Intune, for mobile and desktop device management.
 * Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to workplace applications and devices.
 * Create and maintain documentation for processes and configurations.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional IT teams to deliver integrated solutions.
   
   

Qualifications


 * 3-5 years of experience in workplace engineering or endpoint management.
 * Experience with AVD (Azure Virtual Desktop)
 * Strong knowledge of software deployment, security policies, compliance and experience with networking concepts (TCP/IP, DNS, VLANs)
 * Proficient in Microsoft Intune and Jamf management tools; Linux client management is a plus.
 * Experience with Azure or similar cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
 * Skilled in scripting with PowerShell and Bash
 * Good verbal and written communication skills
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
 * Good organizational and time management skills
 * Excellent documentation skills
 * Business fluent English
 * Knowledge of IaC principles (Terraform), Python or similar language, experience with GitHub, CI/CD pipelines, and application deployment are all a plus.
   
   

Additional Information

With more than 1,000 passionate professionals located across 10 European offices, we believe our success comes from working together and leveraging our international strengths. Expect to work in a hybrid environment, collaborating with colleagues in different locations remotely.

Our benefits:

🐾 20% discount in our zooplus shop

📖 Internal and external training

🎈 Team events

✈️ 28 vacation days and days off on 24th and 31st of December

🏋️ Corporate rates at a local gym chain (Body & Soul)

📱 Company mobile phone for work and personal use

Want to know more? Learn more about zooplus here, and check out our LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube to get a glimpse into the zooplus culture.

zooplus is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.

title: System Engineer Infrastructure Services (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

👋🏼 We're Nagarro. We are a digital product engineering company that is scaling in a big way! We build products, services, and experiences that inspire, excite, and delight. We work at scale — across all devices and digital mediums, and our people exist everywhere in the world (18,000 experts across 36 countries, to be exact). Our work culture is dynamic and non-hierarchical. We're looking for great new colleagues. That's where you come in!

Nagarro's global SAP business unit is a leading IT full-service provider for critical business applications and complex ERP landscapes in digital transformation. With more than 1.000 employees, we are one of the most efficient and innovative SAP partners for medium-sized companies and enterprises with an international focus.

We advise our customers on IT strategy and processes, implement and operate systems including the associated support and maintenance. In addition to many years of SAP experience in cross-industry core processes, we have distinctive and specific know-how in retail, the process industry, manufacturing, professional services and the public sector. We take an open-ended approach and support our customers in on-prem, cloud or hybrid scenarios. In addition, we offer products developed in-house to increase efficiency.

Job Description


 * As a System Engineer you are responsible for the analysis, optimization and development of storage/server, backup and virtualization environments.
 * You are involved in the further development of our highly available data center landscape and design IT landscapes and IT processes.
 * You will also be involved in the following project topics: Data center migration, virtualization, automation and cloud computing.
 * You provide 2nd and 3rd level support in the area of infrastructure for our existing customers and advise their departments on technical problems.
   
   

Qualifications


 * You have completed training as an IT specialist or have a degree in (business) informatics.
 * You already have (first) professional experience as a system engineer and knowledge in the following topics: Virtualizations, Operating Systems and Microsoft Services.
 * Your mindset is solution/process-oriented and analytical, and you have strong methodological skills.
 * Distinct customer orientation and the ability to work in a team as well as a convincing appearance round off your profile.
 * You speak fluent German (B2) and good English (B1). Team meetings will be held in English.
   
   

Additional Information


 * 30 days of paid vacation, internal and external training opportunities, MyN – Nagarro Employee Share Program, attractive company car and company bicycle arrangements, company-funded accident insurance policy, modern office space at central locations with high-tech equipment, sports programs, access to the corporate benefits portal, free fruit and drinks.
 * Plenty of room for innovation in a high-growth environment with the latest technologies and products. With us, you can get involved and make a difference.
 * Flat hierarchies and a long-term, stable job with attractive development opportunities.

title: Systems Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Company Overview

KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.

Job Description


 * Analysis of required solutions (problem definitions) of a SEM system - definition of application-related system requirements
 * System characterization, including error budget analysis, concept development and elaboration of optimized system properties/solutions
 * Continuous product enhancement of SEM based Metrology tool
 * Key contact for system related questions for all disciplines – design, electronics development, S/W and application development
 * Support customer escalations by driving root cause analysis using 7-step / 8D at customer sites worldwide (fly and fix)
   
   
   

Minimum Qualifications


 * Higher education, physicist or engineer with specialization in electron beam microscopy
 * Start as young professional (NCG) possible, 2-3 years professional experience or secondary professional training in this area preferred
   
   
   

Experiences:


 * Practical experience in working with/in the characterization of electron beam systems as a whole (system understanding) - source, electron optics (charged particle optics), detectors, probe handling, vacuum systems
 * Imaging and image processing of SEM images
 * Analytical methods/techniques
 * Measurement technologies in semiconductor industry
   
   
   

Knowledge:


 * Calibration and optimization processes of SEM systems – both, function and application
 * Complex relationships of determining parameters of image generation
 * Image processing and image analysis and their basic algorithms
 * Optical measuring processes and methods (e.g. Interferometrie)
 * Analytical theory of errors and error propagation
 * Statistical methods to assess data and results
 * Advantages and disadvantages of existing commercial systems
   
   
   

Tools:


 * Matlab / Python
 * Higher level script languages
   
   
   

We offer a competitive, family friendly total rewards package. We design our programs to reflect our commitment to an inclusive environment, while ensuring we provide benefits that meet the diverse needs of our employees.

KLA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
Senior System Engineer - Frankfurt - FinTech




THE COMPANY:




Our esteemed client, a well established Fin-Tech/Trading Platform. Through a broad range of trading solutions, they provide firms on both the buy- and sell-side with technology, services and tools.




Based in Frankfurt, this company is a leading global provider of trading technology. They offer a comprehensive platform that connects businesses, banks, and financial institutions, enabling efficient and secure trading.




Work on a 24/7, highly resilient, low latency high performance platform. They are looking for a upper Senior System Engineer to come on board to....




THE JOB:




 * Lead the architecture, deployment, and management of infrastructure systems.
 * Including servers, networks, and storage.
 * Design, implement, and maintain cloud and on-premise solutions to ensure scalability and availability.
 * Monitor and optimise infrastructure stability, security, and performance to support business goals
 * Implement new technologies to drive innovation and efficiency.
 * Mentor and guide other engineers
 * Continuously develop skills and contribute to team success




THE CANDIDATE:




 * Extensive expertise in System Engineering / Administration with Linux
 * Proven track record in Infrastructure Automation (Ansible, Saltstack and more)

title: System Engineer
description:
Vay has developed an alternative approach to autonomous driving called Teledriving (remote driving) - to solve transportation in metropolitan areas.

Since becoming the first company that has driven a car on European public roads with no one inside Vay have become the leading Teledriving company in the world setting the global standard for remotely driven vehicles. Vay are now operating a safe, affordable, and sustainable door-to-door mobility service in the Las Vegas, US and will soon begin scaling to other locations in the USA, Europe & beyond. Our Vay Drive service is a driverless delivered, by the minute car rental service, creating an exciting, safe & affordable experience for all.

This is very ambitious. And we can't do it alone. So we'd love to meet you!

The role:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Systems Engineer II or Senior to join our team. In this role, you will take on the critical responsibility of defining system requirements, safety goals, and ensuring vehicle characterisation to support the development and implementation of advanced automotive systems. This position will play a vital role in designing and testing systems related to Safety ECUs, Motion Controllers, Safety, Connectivity, Cloud & App Interfaces and Performance Monitoring. You will also oversee system documentation, reporting, and regulatory compliance in line with industry standards.

The responsibilities:

Requirements Definition and System Architecture:


 * Develop and manage detailed system requirements and architecture for automotive systems, including safety-critical components and performance criteria.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements for Safety ECUs, Motion Controllers and system-level safety goals.
 * Define interfaces for connectivity and cloud-based applications, ensuring integration with vehicle and remote monitoring systems.
   
   

Safety Goals and Compliance:


 * Establish safety goals and standards for system components, working to ensure compliance with industry safety regulations and certifications (e.g., ISO 26262, ASPICE).
 * Collaborate with the safety and compliance teams to integrate regulatory and safety requirements into system designs.
   
   

Vehicle Characterisation and Test Definition:


 * Develop and execute vehicle characterization plans, outlining test parameters and procedures to validate system performance and safety.
 * Define and oversee both in-lab and on-vehicle testing procedures, ensuring alignment with system requirements and safety objectives.
 * Develop testing criteria for motion control systems and safety reactions to evaluate system robustness under various operating conditions.
   
   

Connectivity, Cloud and Application Interfaces:


 * Define interfaces and requirements for cloud connectivity, remote monitoring, and app-based system interactions, ensuring robust communication and data flow.
 * Work closely with Cloud and software development teams to ensure secure and reliable interfaces between vehicle systems and external applications.
   
   

Performance Monitoring and Reporting:


 * Implement performance monitoring frameworks, leveraging data analytics and monitoring tools to track system performance and ensure alignment with safety and operational benchmarks.
 * Document and report on performance metrics, safety compliance, and system testing outcomes for internal and external stakeholders.
   
   

Documentation and Reporting:


 * Develop comprehensive documentation for all system requirements, safety goals, test definitions, and performance monitoring activities.
 * Report regularly to management on project progress, safety compliance, test results, and risk assessments, providing insight into system performance and safety.
   
   

The profile:

Technical Skills:


 * Strong knowledge of automotive safety standards (e.g., ISO 26262, ASPICE) and compliance requirements.
 * Proficiency in requirements management and system architecture tools (e.g., Jama, FlowEngineering, Doors).
 * Knowledge of cloud connectivity, data interfaces, and application integration.
 * Experience with programming languages
 * Familiarity with system monitoring tools (e.g., Grafana) and logging frameworks
 * Understanding of safety protocols, fail-safe mechanisms, and integration testing for real-time systems.
 * Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software or Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
   
   

Soft Skills:


 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
 * Strong organisational and project management abilities.
 * Effective communication skills, with the ability to document and report on complex systems and safety protocols.
 * Collaborative mindset and a proactive approach to cross-functional teamwork.
 * Ability to transition from methodical design to hands-on at vehicle
   
   

Our values:


 * We pioneer change: At Vay, we're doing work that has never been done before. This comes with challenges, frustrations and failures along the way. We embrace these challenges through perseverance and innovation, delivering creative solutions to overcome them.
 * We fuel collaboration: At Vay, we work as a team and strive for a common goal. We celebrate diversity and encourage different opinions. Our teams and partners communicate and collaborate openly. Together we build, improve, and grow.
 * We drive action: At Vay, everyone takes pride and commitment in their role for every task and every challenge. We are biassed towards action and get behind the steering wheel, even when there is none. We are empowered to take initiative and drive it to completion.
 * We build trust: At Vay, we consistently do the right thing, and follow through on our commitments to stakeholders, users and society. We understand their expectations and always respond in a way that feels human and respectful. We always put safety first and safety second.
 * We create magic: At Vay, we don't just make things that work, we build products people love. We create unexpected and delightful moments for our riders. We design end-to-end experiences that leave a lasting expression.
   
   

Additional benefits:


 * You'll be joining a highly committed, experienced, fun, and international team from over 30 countries. The team has previously worked at companies such as Tesla, Google, Waymo, Zoox, Byton, Argo, Amazon, Uber as well as Audi, BMW, and Daimler and has founded various companies before
 * You would be a part of solving transportation in metropolitan areas all over the world – from Europe
 * We organise thoughtful & fun team events throughout the year
 * We provide healthy snacks, drinks, and coffee at our waterfront office in Berlin
 * Company ESOP (stock options)
 * Free German classes
 * Unlimited paid vacation days
   
   

Vay is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

Come join the future!

title: System Engineer - Connectivity & IoT (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

The purpose of this role is to ensure that the design of the system aligns with overall business objectives, regulatory requirements, and industry standards. The strategic contribution of this role is to ensure that the designed system maximizes value to the company and can be operated efficiently and effectively during its product lifecycle.


 * You will create architecture concepts for integration of various systems
 * You will manage functional and physical integration of systems on aircraft and ground segments
 * You will define and manage hardware and software interfaces
 * You will perform and review requirements decomposition
 * You will support functional decompositions to define aircraft and system functions
 * You will coordinate between multiple stakeholders, internal and external to Volocopter, for the success of our projects
 * You will adapt systems engineering in a pragmatic way to support team objectives and fast development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or similar
 * 3+ years of experience in hardware engineering and firmware development, with a focus on avionics systems
 * Strong understanding of UAS and support system functions and systems design
 * Strong understanding of avionics systems, including system-level design, integration, and testing
 * Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
 * Experience in writing and managing requirements
 * Knowledge of regulatory and certification requirements for aviation products, such as RTCA/DO-178, RTCA/DO-254, and ARINC-429 as well as ARINC-825 beneficial
 * Knowledge of the following tools is highly beneficial: Windchill RV&S, Systems Modeling Language (SysML), Unified Modeling Language (UML), Capella, Basic CAD skills
 * Drone piloting experience is beneficial along with pilot license and radio license
 * The following soft skills are highly beneficial:
    * Excellent teamwork communication and collaboration skills,
    * Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment,
    * Ability to manage varied tasks and prioritize workload,
    * Ability to work methodically in a fast-paced environment with evolving priorities.
      

Additional Information

Our Volocopter flight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity at Volocopter:

Our differences are what make us great. Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential.

description:

title: Construction Site Systems Engineer
description:
Fluor GmbH is the German subsidiary of Fluor Corporation (USA) with office locations in Mannheim, Berlin and Ratingen. As an engineering services company with around 100 employees (30 000 around the world), we offer our clients solutions in industrial plants and infrastructure facilities in the areas of Energy Solutions and Advanced Technologies & Life Sciences with a focus on Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM).




At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived because of embracing differences.




For our project site in Heide, Schleswig-Holstein, we are currently looking for Construction Site Systems Engineer to support our project team for the next two years as of now.




Construction Site Systems Engineer

Heide, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany (on site)




This role provides construction automation support and technical advice for projects, responsible for managing the project implementation and coordination of construction automation systems. (iConstruct,Synchro,Navisworks)




PRINCIPAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Provide technical configuration and coordination of the support for construction systems
 * Communicate the data integration requirements between construction systems.
 * Stay current on research dealing with construction automation technologies and supported construction work practices with the ability to apply knowledge gained.
 * Perform construction related automation duties, and ensuring the uniformity of automation execution within Fluor's Operating System Requirements (OSR).
 * Maintain compliance with all applicable policies, procedures, and global standards.




BASIC JOB REQUIREMENTS:

 * Experience in using iConstruct, Navisworks and/or Synchro or equivalent 3D/4D systems.
 * 8 years of work-related experience.
 * Knowledge and understanding of project construction work processes either through project experience or training with specific knowledge regarding the interaction and exchange of knowledge between engineering disciplines, construction, vendors, contractors, and clients.
 * Work permit in Germany.
 * German language and English language.

title: Staff Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Company Description

Enpal is Germany's first GreenTech unicorn and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe.

We are building the largest renewable community in Europe and tackling the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

We simplify providing green energy for our customers by providing a fully integrated solution with solar systems, heat pump, batteries, and home management system. In addition to contributing to a worthwhile cause, our customers directly benefit from reduced energy bills.

Job Description

As a Staff Engineer you will be solving complex technical problems impacting thousands of customers. Examples of the problems we are working on: building real-time systems for operating energy devices, introducing new product lines in our home energy management system, implementing tooling for a multi-channel sales, or scaling and operating cloud infrastructure by introducing a shared Kubernetes cluster in Azure.

Staff Engineers at Enpal thrive while providing direction and setting the bar for quality for technical problem solving. They are hands-on role models driving impact with delivery and architecture. They excel at taking ownership of complex projects and drive impact across multiple teams and domains.

We are looking for proactive engineers that will make the lives of our customers and Enpal itself better.

Join us to develop your professional skills, take part in the energy revolution, and let us take ownership of the sustainable change we want to see in the world together! We are looking forward to your application.

At Enpal, you would be


 * building software. We are serious about delivering incremental value in each iteration, and we celebrate when we improve people's experience with our solution, make an impact towards our climate goals.
 * stability driving architecture and technical vision. We are fusing old and new technologies; cloud-native microservices, IoT applications, a Salesforce backbone, an event-driven architecture. This means we analyze new requirements critically to see which moving parts would have to change, explore opportunities to solve organization-spanning challenges with elegant architectural solutions.
 * growing and learning. Do you know all there is to know about Kafka or are you experienced on graceful degradation? We’d love to learn from your knowledge. Feel like you're behind on test-driven development in React, is Terraform new to you? We’ll make sure you grow through our knowledge.
 * improving developer tooling. Nobody wants to stay up until midnight to deploy new solutions, or run the same regression tests manually day in, day out. We're about improving, automating as much as we can including load tests and vulnerability scans.
 * steering for empathy and understanding. Only when we comprehend what the market needs we can create solutions that truly address underlying challenges. Ask critical questions and listen to operations, craftspeople, sales - there are so many stakeholders and users to get input from, and balancing their needs leads to the best solutions.
   
   
   

Qualifications

We are looking for roughly a 50% fit with for what we ask. The other 50% is a surprise to us, it is the magic you bring to the table and the diversity in which you make us grow.


 * you have over 8 years of experience in software development
 * you are either experienced in C#, or with a broad range of languages including for example Java and Go.
 * you have work experience with building cloud-native applications
 * you feel comfortable with roughly half of the following technologies: Azure, React, Flutter, Salesforce, Terraform, Kubernetes, event-driven architectures.
 * you communicate clearly in English, spoken and written. Crisp and concise ways of formulating your ideas and opinions. Knowledge of German is a plus.
 * you are inspired by the energy transition and want to make a difference. We are one of the biggest players in the solar business and want to make this change with you.
 * you want to participate in a company where empowerment and initiative is valued. We are looking for people who want to grow their personal skills and knowledge, take responsibility, steer and influence for what they feel is right.
 * agile and lean values are embodied by you. People over processes. Code over documentation. Reducing waste by building minimum viable products first, testing it with real users, growing and maintaining solutions as requirements evolve.
   
   
   

Additional Information

We're offering


 * The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
 * Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
 * Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
 * A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
   
   
   

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

title: System Optimization Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

100% Fossil-free: We don't just dream of a sustainable and livable world - we shape it together and with passion! For over 20 years, we have been a driving force in the expansion of renewable energies. We generate, store and deliver green energy around the globe - with wind, solar, biogas and hydrogen. Around 1,000 employees at various locations worldwide share our mission: to generate renewable energy sustainably for a livable earth.  

Become a part of the ENERTRAG team at our location in Berlin as System Optimization Engineer (m/f/d) and let's advance the energy transition together.

Job Description


 * You work with the System Planning team to perform techno-economic optimisation of Power-to-X projects, guided by specific project assumptions from the project developers.
 * You develop and maintain software tools that support the optimisation efforts of ENERTRAG's System Planning team, ensuring they are effective and up to date.
 * You ensure code versioning, collaboration, and management using Git, following best practices for branching, merging, and pull requests.
 * You adhere to clean coding principles and participate in code reviews to maintain high software quality and consistency.
 * You identify performance bottlenecks and optimize code to improve efficiency and scalability.
 * You help to develop and extend new optimisation models, implementing them in a suitable programming language (e.g., Python).
 * You prepare and present results in a clear and comprehensible manner, using visualisation techniques to enhance understanding.
 * You write reports for internal reviews and decision-making, and conduct site inspections as needed.
   
   

Qualifications


 * You have completed a degree in engineering, physics, mathematics, or a related field, with a specialization in applied mathematics (optimisation, operations research) or energy being a strong advantage.
 * You have at least 4 years of hands-on experience in software development, with advanced proficiency in Python and Git.
 * You have an understanding of energy economics and expertise in numerical optimisation (linear/non-linear programming).
 * You have relevant professional experience in energy system modelling (capacity expansion and production-cost modelling), or have gained experience in energy system modelling and energy economics during post-graduate studies.
 * You demonstrate a structured approach to work, strong teamwork abilities, and a high level of determination.
 * Experience with open energy modelling tools for electricity generation and transmission expansion planning, such as PyPSA, Balmorel, or Calliope, is a plus.
 * You are fluent in English and German a plus.
   
   

Additional Information

#kids: Your children are the most important thing to you? For us, too. That's why you receive a daycare allowance from us.

#jobrad: Would you like to have some innovative wind around your ears? Then use our job bike - also privately.

#vacation: You need new energy and are already in a mood for departure? We offer 30 days of vacation.

#retirementprovision: We are not only thinking about tomorrow for the sake of the environment, but also for you. That's why we offer you access to the Allianz private pension plan. You will also receive an allowance from ENERTRAG SE in the amount of the social security contributions saved.

#mobilework: You want to stay flexible? Depending on the job, we decide together whether you prefer to come to the office or work from home.

#worklifebalance: You know best at what time of the day the drive is strongest for you. Therefore, you also decide at which working hours you want to use your power around the core working hours.

#training: Do you want new impulses to expand your potential? With us you have the opportunity for individual development with a generous training budget.

#health: Your well-being is close to our hearts. So that you don't lose your vitality, we offer you company health management and accident insurance.

#language: Do you speak English? No? Then simply learn it together with us.

#drinksforfree: Water, coffee and tea - if you like, you can also have a juice or fresh fruit.

#teamevents: To let work be work, we invite you once a year to our big summer party and to other team events in between.

#fossilfree: This should not remain just a dream! Take advantage of the great creative leeway to shape a sustainable and livable world.

Do you have any questions in advance? Then please get in touch with your contact person Karo. You can reach her at: [email protected]


 * What counts for us are your skills and your motivation to advance renewable energies with us - not age, gender, skin color, handicap, origin, sexual orientation or religion.

title: System Engineer/Admin - Linux - Berlin | 60k
description:
System Engineer/Admin - Linux - Berlin | 60k




We are a team-cultured and innovative health insurance software platform looking for skilled Java Developers to join their team, in Berlin. Providing the opportunity to work with real, impactful software projects that make a difference to everyday people and positively affect society.




We're looking for a skilled Linux System Engineer to collaborate with our team and ensure the seamless operation of our productive, test, and development servers.

Your main tasks will involve independently and collaboratively developing and implementing update, backup, and high availability concepts. Additionally, you'll be responsible for devising structured solutions to meet new requirements.




Your Profile:

 * Completed training as an IT specialist for system integration with relevant work experience, or a relevant degree, or equivalent knowledge.
 * Proficiency in Linux systems administration

title: Battery System Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

As a Battery System Engineer (m/f/d), you will play a crucial role in our mission to develop cutting-edge battery solutions for aerospace and safety-critical applications. Your extensive knowledge of system engineering processes and electrical engineering background will be instrumental in ensuring the reliability, safety, and performance of our battery systems.

Your mission during this flight:


 * System Engineering Expertise: Apply your substantial knowledge of system engineering processes to evaluate requirements, design descriptions, functions, and more at both the system and component levels. Ensure that our battery systems meet the highest safety and performance standards.
 * Aerospace and Safety-Critical Focus: Leverage your experience in aerospace or other safety-critical applications to align battery system development with industry-specific requirements and regulatory standards.
 * Electrical Engineering: Apply your electrical engineering background to contribute to the design and integration of electrical components within our battery systems.
 * Requirements Management: Handle internal system engineering processes aligned with development lifecycle needs, including rigorous requirements management and milestone deliverables.
 * Component Design Documentation: Take ownership of component design description documents and interface control documents to ensure the clarity and effectiveness of our designs.
 * Supplier Collaboration: Review and collaborate on supplier documents, such as requirement specifications and design descriptions, to maintain consistency and quality across the supply chain.
 * Validation and Verification: Specify and support the validation and verification activities of component requirements, adhering to safety-critical aerospace standards.
 * Milestone Support: Provide support for system-level and component-level milestones, such as Preliminary Design Review (PDR), Critical Design Review (CDR), and Test Readiness Review (TRR).
 * Regulatory Compliance: Collaborate with regulatory authorities like EASA to ensure our battery systems comply with safety and certification standards as needed.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field
 * Substantial knowledge of system engineering processes, particularly in aerospace or safety-critical applications
 * Proficiency in at least one requirements management tool (e.g., DOORS, Integrity)
 * Team player with the ability to lead technical discussions and effectively organize and execute tasks
 * Fluent in English
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Basic knowledge of high-voltage (HV) and Li-ion batteries, brushless DC motor control, DC power distribution, digital communication buses, and/or model-based systems engineering
 * Experience with Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Failure Modes, Effects, and Criticality Analysis (FMECA)
 * Knowledge of aerospace standards and guidelines, such as ARP-4761, DO-254, DO-311, and DO-160
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System Engineer
description:
Location: Erlangen, Germany

Employment Type: Full-time




About Us

At Interherence, we develop cutting-edge optical detection systems and intelligent image analysis platforms for characterizing single bionanoparticles, such as viral vectors, proteins, and single molecules. Our innovative technologies combine precision optics and advanced algorithms, empowering researchers and industries worldwide.




Built on a culture of collaboration and inclusivity, our diverse team thrives on pushing the boundaries of optical microscopy and single-particle detection. Join us in shaping the future of bionanoparticle analysis and making a meaningful impact.




Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled and enthusiastic System Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a hands-on mentality, a strong technical background, and a proven ability to work across disciplines such as optical microscopy, electronics, and programming. In this role, you will play a critical part in the development, integration, and optimization of complex systems, ensuring they meet the high standards our customers demand.




Key Responsibilities

·      Design, develop, and implement system-level solutions for advanced microscopy instruments. 

·      Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, manufacturing, and software development, to ensure seamless system integration. 

·      Troubleshoot and optimize optical, electronic, and software components.

·      Manage and oversee projects from conception to completion, ensuring on-time delivery and adherence to specifications.

·      Document processes, configurations, and testing procedures.

·      Provide technical support and training to customers and internal teams.




Qualifications and Skills

Experience: 3-5 years of professional experience in system engineering or related fields. Prior experience working in a startup environment is considered a plus.

Technical Expertise:

·      Hands-on experience with optical microscopy and instrumentation.

·      Proficiency in electronics and hardware integration.

·      Programming skills in languages such as Python, C++, or MATLAB.

·      Project Management: Proven ability to manage complex projects effectively, meeting deadlines and ensuring quality.




Soft Skills:

·      Problem-solving mindset and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

·      Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with team members and clients.




Language Skills:

·      English fluency is mandatory.

·      German language skills are a plus.




Why Join Us?

·      Be part of a cutting-edge company revolutionizing the field of microscopy.

·      Work in a collaborative and diverse environment where your ideas and expertise will have a real impact.

·      Access to ongoing professional development opportunities and the latest technologies.




Application Process:

Please send your CV and a cover letter detailing your qualifications and interest in the position. We look forward to learning more about you!

________________________________________

Interherence is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: System Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Unser Kunde ist ein innovativer IT-Dienstleister, der moderne Lösungen wie IT-Outsourcing, Cloud-Dienste und den Betrieb hochverfügbarer Rechenzentren bietet. Nachhaltigkeit und Effizienz stehen im Fokus, ebenso wie die Entwicklung und Umsetzung maßgeschneiderter IT-Architekturen.




Rund die Hälfte der Projekte und Aktivitäten richtet sich auf die Unterstützung eines großen Mutterkonzerns im Energie- und Infrastrukturbereich, was eine spannende Mischung aus interner Stabilität und externen Projekten ermöglicht.

Ihre Qualifikationen:

 * Teamarbeit macht Ihnen Freude, und Sie schätzen die Möglichkeit, sich unternehmensweit zu vernetzen und einzubringen.




Ihre Benefits:

 * Ein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag mit attraktiver Vergütung (je nach Erfahrung bis zu 80.000 €)

Ergreifen Sie die Chance!




Senden Sie mir, Anna Scharmer, Ihren aktuellen Lebenslauf an a.scharmer@greifenberg.de und teilen Sie mir mit, wann ich Sie für ein erstes Telefonat erreichen kann. Sie haben vorab Frage? Melden Sie sich unter der Nummer +49 89 93 90 990 65 bei mir.




Über uns: Greifenberg ist eine hoch spezialisierte Personalberatung in den Bereichen IT/SAP, Life Science, und Finance. Wir verstehen uns als internationale Rekrutierungsboutique, deshalb arbeiten wir ausschließlich mit ausgewählten Kunden und ebenso ausgewählten Kandidaten. Unsere Prozesse sind effektiv und einfach gehalten. Wir legen sehr viel Wert auf guten Service, arbeiten lösungsorientiert und selbstverständlich diskret.

 * Oversee system design, integration, and verification, ensuring alignment with project goals and milestones.
 * Lead system-level performance analysis and ensure compliance with technical requirements.
 * Provide technical guidance on quality, cost, and schedule issues, collaborating with the Product Manager and Project Manager to implement corrective actions.
 * Prepare and deliver regular progress reports on technical milestones, deviations, and risks.
 * Participate in project planning and forecasting, ensuring resource allocation and schedules align with technical needs.
 * Implement and optimize technical processes and best practices within the engineering and development teams.
   
   

What You Bring With You


 * Minimum Bachelor's degree in engineering, or a related field.
 * Minimum 4 years’ of practical experience in the relevant field, proven experience in system engineering within a complex project environment.
 * Strong background in system integration, performance analysis, and technical problem-solving.
 * Excellent communication and collaboration skills in cross-functional teams.
 * Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet project milestones in a fast-paced environment.
 * You enjoy working in an innovative, dynamic, and team-oriented environment.
 * Good written and spoken English and/or German communication skills.
   
   

What We Offer You

Be part of the company that is changing the world!

Have you always wanted to wear your favourite space outfit to work? Then you are exactly the

right fit for us! Forget the office politics and come and work with inspiring colleagues from all

over the world as you embark on an incredible journey with Mynaric to work on unique and

challenging projects and make a real contribution to the future of connectivity.

We offer you permanent employment, varied areas of responsibility, and attractive employee.

benefits. Mynaric is absolutely committed to being an equal opportunity employer so we

welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, gender,

disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

About Us

Mynaric produces optical fiber for the skies and, as a pioneer in laser communications, enables extremely fast and secure wireless data transmission between satellites, drones and the ground. The products are used by well-known international technology companies to build global communication networks. The emerging Internet over the clouds will connect the previously disconnected 3 billion people, bring the Internet of Things to the remotest corners of the earth and make international communication more secure than ever.

title: System Engineer Microsoft 365 - fully remote (m/f/d)
description:
About Us

You’ll be working for eGroup Technologies, which is an IT-subsidiary of the ebuero AG. ebuero AG is the leading provider of virtual office services in Europe. We develop and operate a Software-as-a-Service platform to provide tens of thousands of freelancers and small businesses customers across Europe with remote secretarial and new work solutions. Our mission is to give people the space to focus on what they are best at.

We are in the middle of our journey from OnPrem infrastructure to Cloud native. For this journey we are looking for a M365 Specialist.

Your Role

As a System Engineer specializing in Microsoft 365, you will play a key role in developing and managing the IT infrastructure behind our SaaS office and contact center platform. Here’s what your responsibilities will include:


 * Microsoft 365 Administration: Oversee and enhance our Microsoft 365 environment (AAD, Exchange, Teams, W365) for over 1,000 users.
 * Client Management: Utilize MS Endpoint Manager & Defender to manage a fleet of 500+ clients.
 * Application Integration: Integrate new applications with AAD and SCIM.
 * Automation: Streamline processes by automating tasks with PowerShell and GraphAPI in a CI/CD environment.
 * Server Administration: Administer and migrate our 50+ Windows Servers to SaaS or PaaS on AWS.
   
   
   

What you bring to the table


 * Team Spirit: You contribute positively to our collaborative culture.
 * Self-Management: You excel in independently coordinating and prioritizing tasks.
 * Microsoft 365 Expertise: Strong experience with Microsoft 365 tools, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, and Microsoft Endpoint Manager.
 * Automation Skills: Proficiency in automation with PowerShell scripting.
 * Server Administration: Hands-on experience with Windows Server, including Active Directory management.
   
   
   

Why Join Us?


 * Stability and Growth: We’re a successful, fast-growing company with over 20 years of industry experience.
 * Inclusive Culture: Join an international team that enjoys collaborating, having lunch together, and celebrating at team events and company-wide gatherings like our summer and Christmas parties.
 * Direct Access: Flat hierarchies and open communication with colleagues across departments, including C-level executives and founders.
 * Encouraged Innovation: We value fresh ideas, creative approaches, and an all-hands mentality in problem-solving.
 * Career Development: Take advantage of opportunities to shape processes, learn new technologies, and become an expert in your field.
   
   
   

Our Offer


 * Competitive Salary & Stability: Secure a position with a well-established, growing company.
 * Choose Your Tech: Opt for a Windows laptop or MacBook, and get an Android or iOS smartphone for work and personal use.
 * Flexible Work Location: Choose to work from our Berlin or Nürnberg office, or fully remote within Europe.
 * Continuous Learning Opportunities: Access a range of edX and Pluralsight courses, along with offsite training to support your career growth.
 * Work-Life Balance: Enjoy flexible core hours and a hybrid work model that fits around your family, hobbies, and personal needs.
 * On-Site Perks: Free drinks, fresh fruits, and more location-specific benefits to make your work environment enjoyable.
   
   
   

Sounds terrific? Great! Let’s get in touch.

We at eGroup are fostering diversity and are committed to create teams with a broad variety of backgrounds, experiences, perspectives and skills. All decisions about interviews, offers and employment are based on expertise, merit and business need.

title: System Engineer
description:
The Role

The Systems Engineer is part of the engineering team that develops marine navigation and bridge systems for OSI’s government and naval markets. The Systems Engineer plays a critical role in the development of the overall system requirements’ design and definition for OSI’s complex products. With offices globally, OSI Maritime Systems are now opening in Kiel, Germany. This role will be a part of the growth of this office.




Key Responsibilities

 * Assists senior engineers in developing design concepts and generates technical proposal material in response to Request for Quotation (RFQ)
 * Develops system designs, performs functional analysis, defines systems architecture, defines interfaces and specification, performs trade-studies and documents the design by writing SSDD, ICDs, SRS
 * Performs requirement analysis, traceability and maintenance of requirements
 * Coordinates design of subsystems and integration of total system
 * Identifies, analyzes and resolves program support deficiencies
 * Develops and recommends corrective actions
 * Designs to government standards, including Military and IMO standards, ensuring ongoing compliance and adherence to requirements
 * Ensures availability, reliability and other logistics support considerations are part of the system design process
 * Reviews obsolescence issues and recommends design changes
 * Attends and participates in customer design reviews and acceptance events
 * May participate in system integration tests, trials, and acceptance tests at customer facilities
 * Writes acceptance test procedures
 * Manages scope of work, schedules work, estimates effort and costs, and identifies technical risks; effectively communicates status on a regular basis to management




Qualifications

 * Degree in Engineering or Physics, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience
 * 4 years’ engineering experience, Minimum 3 years’ experience in Systems Engineering;
 * Experience in marine electronics and integrated bridge systems a significant asset; experience in defense or government domain preferably in naval ship sector a significant asset
 * Strong knowledge of marine navigation and tactical sensors or systems;
 * Excellent knowledge of Systems Engineering principles, standards and best practices;
 * Familiarity with requirements and verification management tools such as DOORS;
