title: Software Engineer BMS (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced BMS Software Developer to join our Battery Management team. As a BMS Software Developer, you will play a key role in the development of Battery Management Systems (BMS) software for our aerospace applications. You will leverage model-based development tools like Simulink and Embedded Coder to design, implement, and verify BMS software functionalities. Your strong background in aerospace systems, coupled with your deep knowledge of battery management systems, will be instrumental in delivering high-quality software solutions.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the requirements and specifications for BMS software development.
 * Utilize model-based development tools, such as Simulink and Embedded Coder, to design, simulate, and generate production-ready code for BMS software functionalities.
 * Develop and maintain software architecture and detailed design documentation for the BMS software components.
 * Implement software algorithms and control strategies to enable accurate and reliable battery management in aerospace systems.
 * Perform software integration and verification activities, ensuring compliance with aerospace industry standards and requirements.
 * Conduct software testing and debugging to identify and resolve issues, ensuring the stability and reliability of the BMS software.
 * Collaborate with hardware engineers to ensure seamless integration of software with BMS hardware components.
 * Participate in design reviews, code inspections, and other engineering activities to ensure the quality and efficiency of the BMS software development process.
 * Stay up to date with the latest advancements and best practices in BMS software development, as well as industry trends in aerospace systems.
 * Collaborate with the certification team to ensure compliance with relevant aerospace standards, such as DO-178C.
 * Support system-level testing and validation efforts, including hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) and software-in-the-loop (SIL) simulations.
 * Provide technical expertise and guidance to the engineering team, offering insights and recommendations for improving BMS software performance and reliability.
 * Collaborate with suppliers and external partners as needed, ensuring seamless integration of third-party software components and modules.
 * Document software development processes, methodologies, and design decisions for future reference and knowledge transfer.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
 * At least 8 years of extensive experience in software development.
 * 5+ years of working experience in an aerospace systems development environment.
 * Proficiency in model-based development tools, such as Simulink and Embedded Coder, for designing and implementing software algorithms.
 * Strong understanding of battery management systems and their application in aerospace systems.
 * Knowledge of relevant aerospace standards and regulations, including DO-178C, and their impact on software development.
 * Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in embedded systems development, such as C and C++.
 * Experience with software integration, verification, and testing in the aerospace industry.
 * Familiarity with software development processes and methodologies, including version control systems and issue tracking tools.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to debug and resolve software issues efficiently.
 * Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
 * Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on producing high-quality and reliable software solutions.
 * Familiarity with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) and software-in-the-loop (SIL) simulations.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience with software development for safety-critical systems in the aerospace industry.
 * Familiarity with battery chemistries and characteristics, and their implications on battery management systems.
 * Knowledge of battery management system algorithms, such as state estimation, cell balancing, and fault detection.
 * Understanding of system-level integration and validation processes for aerospace systems.
 * Familiarity with software development for real-time operating systems(RTOS).
 * Experience with software certification processes and guidelines, such as DO-178C.
 * Familiarity with industry best practices for software development, including coding standards and software testing methodologies.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Systems Engineer Aerospace
description:
DSI Aerospace GmbH develops innovative hardware and FPGA/software solutions and computer technologies for space applications. Our hardware and FPGA/software solutions are flying as part of prominent space programs such as ExoMars (Mars mission) and JUICE (Jupiter mission). Since 1997, our steadily-growing international team has been producing high-performance, customer-specific and dependable solutions.

We are looking for skilled and motivated colleagues who are passionate about solutions for the leading European satellite missions.

Aufgaben


 * Technical Management of our international aerospace projects/lead for technical meetings with customers
 * Presentation of our technical solutions to the customer
 * Technical management of the development team
 * Requirements Engineering
 * Electronic systems planning and specification
 * Execution of System and Failure Analyses
 * Monitoring of the technical implementation performed by our development team
 * Monitoring of Test & Verification processes of our developed products
   
   

Profil


 * Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics or in a comparable field
 * Minimum three years of experience in the field of development of Electronic Systems for space flight applications
 * Basic understanding of electronics and electronics circuits
 * Participation in solving interdisciplinary challenges
 * A structured, independent and responsible approach to work and a high level of quality awareness
 * Ability to work under tight deadlines and to prioritize workload
 * Flexibility and team skills
 * High level of written English and at least basic fluency in spoken English
 * Basic written and verbal communication skills in German would be beneficial
   
   

Wir bieten


 * Challenging and varied tasks encompassing all aspects of Systems Engineering

title: Factory Systems Engineer (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description:
What To Expect
Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg marks a defining moment in Europe for Tesla’s mission of accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. Here we will launch revolutionary products on a massive scale, using extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Our employees will ensure that we achieve our goals, and we welcome you to help us write the next chapter of our success story.

Looking for a highly motivated Engineer to join the Factory Planning & Systems Team at Tesla. This role would be an opportunity to work on projects across the complete Gigafactory with various teams on solving cross functional issues driving critical efficiency related decisions and tangible improvements and benefits for the organization.

What You'll Do

Reporting to Engineering Lead Factory Planning & Systems Will support setting the right priorities in an environment with many competing needs associated to factory design. Focus will lay on the Vehicle Manufacturing & Powertrain Shops The role requires problem solving skills, exceptional teamwork, and communication skills. The primary focus for this role will be supporting the Factory Systems Team to integrate equipment and production lines across the factory, managing timelines on upcoming changes and tracking critical KPIs for the factory. You will support on factory master layout design, permitting process, material flow, production lines, building design through all major project phases including design, equipment specifications and selection, procurement, construction/installation, integration, commissioning, buyoff and start of production. Generate presentation content for project status updates.


What You'll Bring

BS in a relevant engineering program such as Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Management, Process Engineering or related degree, MS preferred. Or evidence of exceptional ability.2+ years of proven experience implementing and optimizing complex manual and automated manufacturing equipment & processes, preferably in the automotive industry. Strong bias in success in project management, communications, influencing others, cross-functional team interaction, and driving results on time. Excellent organization, problem solving, tactical thinking, and time management skills. A detail-oriented personality with solid documentation and reporting skills. Solid grasp on engineering fundamentals Preferably experience and/or knowledge in Vehicle, Powertrain and Cell Manufacturing Motivated, active collaborator Working knowledge of technical software: CAD, Microsoft Project, Microsoft office. Understanding of planning and building an electric vehicle plant Proven interest in Tesla's mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy, through extracurricular activities, academic projects, passion projects, or equivalent experiences. Fluent in English, preferably also in German


What we offer:

You will be working in our state-of-the-art Gigafactory where you’ll solve the world's most interesting problems with the best and brightest people who share a passion to change the world. Tesla’s compensation package includes a competitive salary and Tesla shares or bonuses. Typical benefits that we provide are 30 vacation days, an occupational pension, employee life and disability insurances, free EV charging, product discounts and various transportation benefits.

title: Staff Engineer, Core Developer Experience - Build & Release
description:
Job Description

As a Staff Engineer in the Core Group you will be exposed to:

Platform Development: Lead the design and development of a robust, scalable platform architecture that supports our business goals and growth.

Technical Leadership: Provide technical direction and leadership to multiple teams to ensure the best software development, deployment, and maintenance practices.

Innovation: Drive the adoption of cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to improve platform efficiency, scalability, reliability and security.

Mentor: Mentor and guide engineers at various levels, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.

Collaborate: Work closely with Core´s engineers and other engineering teams to align platform initiatives with business needs and goals.

Developer Experience: Ensure the platform's high reliability by advocating for and implementing effective solutions across the engineering organisation. Design, develop, and maintain build and release processes that automate and streamline the daily work of engineers. Create systems to assess and enhance the platform's efficiency and maturity.

Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of platform architecture, design decisions, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding.

Security: Implement and enforce best practices to protect data and maintain the integrity of our platform in alignment with our Security Engineers.

Data-driven decision-making: Using facts, metrics, and data to guide strategic decisions that align with your goals, objectives, and initiatives.

Hands-on: Jump on implementation topics wherever seniority is needed. (Go/Python)

Our humble expectations

Must haves:


 * +2 years of proven experience as a Staff- or Principal Engineer in large-scale CI/CD tooling.
 * 8+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
 * Strong understanding of software development processes and best practices.
 * Proficiency in or willingness to learn at least one of the following programming languages: Python3, Go (we primarily use Python and Go in our team).
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 * Strong communication and collaboration skills.
 * Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
 * Strong familiarity with containerisation and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
 * Proactive, data-driven mindset with the ability to drive changes that impact the entire organisation.
 * Strong familiarity with containerisation and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
 * Experience in supporting large-scale development teams across multiple locations.
 * Experience in build and release domain within +500 microservices and multi-region Kubernetes clusters
   
   

Nice to haves:


 * Experience with Bazel, Spinnaker, or other large-scale build and deployment tools.
 * Knowledge of package management, compliance & validations, and metrics.
 * Familiarity with on-call rotations and SOX compliance.
 * Experience with asynchronous event streaming platforms or message queues (e.g., Kafka).
   
   

Next Steps

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right people, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt & Doordash!

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

title: Systems Engineer, Managed Operations
description:
Description

AWS is set to introduce the inaugural European Sovereign Cloud (ESC), marking a significant development in utility computing (UC). To spearhead this initiative, we are actively seeking experienced systems engineers with a strong background in automation and operations. As part of the AWS Managed Operations team, you will play a pivotal role in building and leading operations and development teams dedicated to delivering high-availability AWS services, including EC2, S3, Dynamo, Lambda, and Bedrock, exclusively for EU customers. For more information on ESC please check out our blog: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/in-the-works-aws-european-sovereign-cloud/

Your responsibilities will encompass overseeing the launch of the ESC in 2025, working closely with global AWS teams, and influencing the evolution of AWS services and technology. A typical day in this role involves collaborating with technology leaders, contributing to the enhancement of day-to-day operations, and ensuring improvements in availability, reliability, latency, performance, and efficiency of the ESC. You will be required to occasionally participate in “on-call” rotations to resolve incidents occurring out-of-hours.

The overarching goal is to deliver scalable services and ensure a high-availability experience for EU customers. If you are an experienced professional ready for a challenging and impactful opportunity, we invite you to join our efforts in building a best-in-class development engineering and operations team that aligns with AWS' commitment to customer satisfaction and continual innovation.

Utility Computing (UC)

European Sovereign Cloud (ESC) is a part of AWS Utility Computing (UC).

AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations — from foundational services such as Amazon’s Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS’s services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you’ll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS. Within AWS UC, Managed Operations engineers engage with AWS customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.

A day in the life

Embark on a week filled with meaningful contributions to the operation and improvement of significant software systems. You dedicate a substantial portion of your time to carefully review the operational health of services within your team's responsibility. In the process, you diligently identify anomalies and craft actionable bug reports, aspiring to enhance the overall efficiency and performance of your systems.

In addition to these responsibilities, you offer constructive feedback on change management documents and work earnestly to address your team's operational backlog. Through a collaborative effort, you strive to navigate challenges and ensure the seamless functionality of your systems. Additionally, you engage in the development and testing of scripts, hoping to provide practical solutions to enhance your workflows.

Beyond the technical aspects, you assume a role as an educator, sharing insights on the complexities of the European Sovereign Cloud with service teams. It's a humbling experience for you to contribute to the collective knowledge of the team, fostering a culture of mutual understanding.

This week encapsulates your commitment to continuous learning and improvement, acknowledging that every effort, no matter how small, contributes to the collective success of your team and the reliability of your software systems.

In addition to these responsibilities, your position involves 24x7 on-call responsibility. You work as a team to root-cause issues and ensure your systems remain resilient and fault-tolerant, underscoring your commitment to maintaining operational excellence.

Eligibility requirement


 * Fluency in written and spoken English is required.
 * Successful applicants must have the legal right to work in Germany.
 * Amazon will provide relocation support for successful applicants relocating within the European Union.
   
   

About The Team

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Basic Qualifications


 * Experience operating software systems or related fields
 * Proficient working across hardware, software, networking, operating systems, with significant depth and breadth of understanding in at least one
 * Experience documenting difficult technical problems and writing standard operational procedure (SOP)
 * Proficient scripting processes in a language such as Bash, Python, or Ruby or similar
 * Experienced diagnostician; understanding architecture and how systems interact to root-cause problems
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Experience with Infrastructure as Code, (such as CDK, CloudFormation, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, or similar)
 * Experience operating services in AWS
 * Experience performance tuning software applications and optimizing fleet utilization
 * Proficient troubleshooting and anticipating problems that affect the performance, reliability, or availability of software systems
   
   

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

m/w/d

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

    * Microsoft 365 (Azure Hybrid, Exchange, Intune, Defender)
    * Virtualization (VMware, NAS/SAN)
    * Linux
    * Backup (VEEAM)

 * You are characterized by a solution and service-oriented way of working and analytical skills
 * Very good written and spoken English
   

Why us?


 * We focus on team spirit, mutual trust, independent action and having fun at work.
 * We support the compatibility of family and career through a great deal of flexibility in the organization of working hours, mobile working and a kindergarten allowance.
 * In addition to an ergonomic and modern working environment, we offer you benefits such as fitness cycling with a job bike, a wide range of sports activities with Hansefit, a subsidized job ticket and much more.
 * Our prime location and good transport links make it easy for you to get to work.
 * We are a dynamic, open-minded company that looks to the future and welcomes new ideas that you bring with you.
   
   

About Us

Who we are

Pointsharp is a European cybersecurity company founded in 2006. Pointsharp delivers specialized software and services that help organizations secure identities, authorization, access, and data in a user-friendly way. We believe easy-to-use security solutions are the foundation for a safe, modern digital workplace.

Pointsharp — Security made easy

Our workplace and culture

We offer a varied and exciting everyday life at an international company that is just at the beginning of our growth journey. At Pointsharp, the employees are in focus. We put a lot of effort into safeguarding our community and culture, a culture that has long been characterized by entrepreneurship and a strong focus on technology. Something that contributes to short decision paths and great opportunities to develop within their role and the company. At Pointsharp, all genders are welcome.

https://www.pointsharp.com/

title: Ground Segment Systems Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Overview

Start Date: As soon as possible

Location: Darmstadt, Germany

Working hours: full time, 40h/week

About LSE Space

We are an independent provider of space services, covering the entire life cycle of space systems, as the main subsidiary of SSC's Engineering Services. Employing over 190 engineers, we provide services to the international space market, including support for all phases of a space mission or full service, operations, independent consulting and training.

Are you fuelled by a passion for satellite operations and ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space? If you answered yes to the question, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact with LSE Space!

We are currently seeking to employ a motivated and experienced Ground Segment Systems Engineer to support our team at EUMETSAT, contributing to the development and maintenance of advanced meteorological satellite systems.

What You´ll Do


 * Perform requirements engineering for ground systems in operations and development
 * Contribute to system and interface design activities
 * Support integration, verification, and validation testing (IV&V)
 * Participate in Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) activities
 * Contribute to operations support and maintenance activities
 * Support configuration management and change control processes
 * Participate in technical reviews and documentation activities
   
   
   

What We Are Looking For


 * A Master´s degree in Aerospace engineering, Computer Science or in a similar subject
 * Strong background and experience in systems engineering and IV&V activities for ground segment elements of earth observation missions
 * Expertise using DOORS, Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) methodologies and SysML
 * Familiarity with space and ground system engineering processes and standards (preferably ECSS)
 * Proficiency in formal testing processes (FAT/OSAT)
 * Fluent in English, both in speech and writing
 * The following skills and experience would be highly desirable:
    * Familiarity with data processing systems for earth observation missions
    * Knowledge of IT/ground segment technologies (databases, virtualization, networking)
    * Experience in maintenance of ground systems and anomaly management
      

About Us

What we offer:


 * Thriving Environment: A growing and international environment with diverse backgrounds to learn from, with a lot of social events.
 * Work-Life Balance: Take advantage of our relocation support and 30 days of paid vacation.
 * Develop yourself: Enjoy permanent employment with diverse opportunities for growth, with our training program and a German language course.
 * Well being: Prioritize your well-being with access to our gym program, bike lease program, and company doctor services.
 * Supportive Workplace: Experience our open-door policy and ISO 9001-certified workplace, where your voice is valued and your contributions recognized
 * Rewards and Incentives: Receive a competitive salary, bonus scheme, deferred compensation scheme and sponsored public transportation tickets.
   
   
   

Our Values

Customer Passion - Collaboration - Care - Curiosity - Courage

In particular this means we always put our customers’ needs at the forefront of everything we do. We aspire to a high level of customer passion. Our policy, as a fair and loyal partner, is to focus on our customers’ goals and generate innovative solutions tailored to the project. Collaboration is the key to our success – one for all and all for one. We care for our people and try to make everything happen – for our employees AND our customers. Only with a high employee well-being our success is possible. We are reliable and result-oriented all the way and we always strive to deliver better than expected. This approach is essential for the benefit of both our clients and teams. As a result, we are able to preserve a spirit of trust and fairness between customers, partners and employees.

LSE Space is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Battery Systems Engineer (Validation)  (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Our custom-built Electric Propulsion System consisting of state-of-the-art battery, power distribution and controlled electric motors are key to making Volocopter’s products extremely safe to fly. With your specific experience in the development of electrical system for aviation or in integrating electric propulsion components into mobility products, you contribute directly to the certification of this uniquely safe and simple flight experience. As an integral part of our Energy Storage Unit (ESU) component development team, you ensure that the proper system development processes are followed by the battery and power distribution teams. 

Your mission during this flight: 


 * As System Engineer you will work closely with colleagues in multiple disciplines to valid requirements, design descriptions, functions etc., at system and component level to meet aircraft level needs.
 * Ensure completeness, correctness and fulfilment of battery requirements
 * Handling internal system engineering process aligned with development lifecycle needs, including requirements management and program milestone deliverables.
 * Ensure successful completion of the V&V program of the battery.
 * Assist in creating the certification plan for battery systems.
 * Take ownership of component design description documents, interface control documents.
 * Perform design reviews of the battery systems & interfaces.
 * Define test articles for sub-system, component, sub-component or part validation.
 * Provide technical review of the design to ensure the complete coverage of the requirements.
 * Specify and support the validation and verification activities of component requirements according to ARP-4754A
 * Provide support for formal audits and exchanges with EASA, as needed.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or equivalent.
 * Strong experience in process and requirement validation.
 * Good knowledge and several years of experience with systems engineering, requirement management, and system architecture in aviation (ARP4754) or other complex product development.
 * In-depth understanding of EASA's SC-VTOL and E-19 regulations and the certification process for batteries used in aviation applications.
 * You have a background in Battery development and have applied experience with DO-311A.
 * Knowledge of certification and development processes and have applied experience with DO-160G.
 * Team player, confident in technical discussions, ability to organize and “get things done”.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Basic knowledge of HV and Li-ion batteries, digital communication buses, and/or model-based systems engineering.
 * Experience with FMEA and FMECA 
 * Experience with battery modeling and simulation tools, such as MATLAB/Simulink.
 * Project management skills with the ability to lead and coordinate verification activities within a multidisciplinary team.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System-Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Was Dich bei uns erwartet


 * Du entwirfst, implementierst und wartest Systemarchitekturen die in unseren einzigartigen windCORES Rechenzentren zum Einsatz kommen
 * Du entwickelst und wartest unsere hochverfügbaren und nachhaltigen Virtualisierungsumgebungen unter Verwendung von Open-Source Technologien
 * Du löst Systemprobleme, stellst technische Unterstützung bereit und berätst interne und externe Kunden
 * Du arbeitest aktiv mit bei der Evaluierung neuer Technologien und Methoden zur Etablierung neuer Standards
 * Du dokumentierst die Systemkonfigurationen und Arbeitsabläufe zur Sicherstellung des operativen Betriebes
 * Du bist Teil eines eingespielten Teams und hast ein kollegiales Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien
 * Arbeitsort ist Paderborn, Homeoffice nach Absprache an einzelnen Tagen möglich
   
   

Was uns überzeugt


 * Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Systemintegrator oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation in ähnlichen Fachbereichen
 * Du hast praktische Erfahrung mit Virtualisierungstechnologien
 * Python und Ansible sind keine Fremdworte für Dich und Du hast einen ausgeprägten Sinn für Automatisierungslösungen
 * Erste Gehversuche in Netzwerktechnologien (BGP, OSPF, L2) sind durchaus wünschenswert
 * Du verfügst über analytische Fähigkeiten und Problemlösungskompetenz, gepaart mit einer selbstständigen Arbeitsweise
 * Du arbeitest gerne mit anderen Zusammen und hast Erfahrungen in der Zusammenarbeit mit interdisziplinären Teams
 * Du sprichst sehr gut Deutsch und Englisch
   
   

Was wir Dir bieten


 * Firmenwagen und Bike Leasing
 * 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr
 * Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
 * Mitarbeiterstromtarif und weitere Sonderzahlungen
 * Firmenevents
 * Mitarbeitenden-Empfehlungsprogramm
 * Einen unbefristeten, sicheren Arbeitsplatz
 * E-Auto-Ladesäulen und kostenloses Laden während der Arbeitszeit
 * Physiotherapeut
 * Kostenloses Obst/Wasser/Kaffee u.v.m.
   
   

Über uns

Die WestfalenWIND-Gruppe ist 2009 aus der Idee heraus entstanden, gemeinsam mehr für die Region erreichen zu können. Mehrere erfahrene Windkraftbetreiber, die zuvor schon eigene Bürgerwind-Projekte entwickelt hatten, haben sich zusammengeschlossen, um gemeinsam Projekte anzugehen. Der Antrieb dabei war und ist: Erneuerbare Energien voranzubringen. Rund 140 Mitarbeiter in den Bereichen Planung, Service, IT und Stromvertrieb sind heute an den Standorten in Paderborn und Lichtenau beschäftigt. Wir haben aus Überzeugung maßgeblich dazu beigetragen, dass der Strombedarf im Kreis Paderborn schon jetzt zu mehr als 100 % aus regenerativen Energien abgedeckt werden kann. Wir können aber nicht nur Windkraft und sauberen Strom, sondern auch Photovoltaik und Green IT. Kurz: Wir sind die Experten für Erneuerbare Energien!

title: Mechanical System Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your crew during this flight:

As a systems engineer for mechanical systems, you will be part of a dynamic and driven team responsible for defining requirements, devising verification strategies, and conducting corresponding test campaigns. Your role will also involve ensuring that all equipment sourced from suppliers align with the specific needs and requirements of Volocopter.

Your mission during this flight:

The role of a system engineer involves overseeing the development, verification, and testing of the internally and externally developed mechanical elements of the aircraft, to ensure it meets all product and certification requirements. You will work closely with your team to optimize the system definition, requirements, and verification, taking into account key factors such as usability, maintenance, costs, and timelines.

You will be responsible for defining testing requirements for both development and verification phases. Ultimately, your efforts will play a vital role in ensuring that the mechanical elements meet stakeholders' expectations and perform to the highest aerospace standards.

You will work autonomously and provide guidance to the rest of the system engineering team as well as other interfaces that depend on the systems engineering process. You will define development and verification strategies, and have a high influence on the development of our mechanical systems.

Your responsibilities will be:


 * Generation and optimization of system engineering processes required to develop structures and mechanical components.
 * Definition, specification, and development assurance for mechanical elements.
 * Verification strategy definition - develop a plan for meeting the requirements, including certification plans and exchanges with the certification authority (e.g. EASA)
 * Structural testing definition and supervision: oversee the testing process to ensure compliance, and address any deviations or non-compliances.
 * Lifecycle management of supplier systems.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering degree (M.Sc., Ph.D.)
 * Minimum 5+ years of professional experience as a systems engineer in mechanical systems in aerospace industry.
 * Proven experience in aircraft development on lightweight composite structures and rotors.
 * Experience with supplier selection, evaluation, and management.
 * Experience with mechanical systems and/or structures certification.
 * Experience in certification according to aerospace standards.
 * A structured way of working and a high sense of accountability.
 * Experience with prototyping and testing.
 * Excellent communication skills with internal and external stakeholders.
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * 7+ years of experience as a systems engineer in mechanical systems in aerospace industry.
 * Hand-on, creative, pragmatic and solution-oriented way of working in cross functional teams.
 * Open-minded and willing to think outside the box.
 * Good understanding light structures and aircraft mechanical systems and certification process.
 * Technical project management experience.
 * Experience with aerospace standards: CS23, CS25, CS27, CS29, SC-VTOL.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Avionics System Engineer - Integration (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You are a Senior System engineer experienced in the development of complex systems and you are passionate about making a difference in eVTOL aviation. You have substantial experience in system architecture and requirements engineering and a profound knowledge of the verification and validation aspects in aviation, and in particular avionics systems. Within a multi-disciplinary team, you will coordinate between the various teams and systems to ensure a successful certification of the avionics systems of the Volocopter aircraft.

Tasks:


 * You will handleinternal system engineering process aligned with development lifecycle needs, including requirements management and program milestone deliverables
 * You will facilitatethe integration activities of the newly developed and COTS equipment (e.g. planning the integration tests, review of the test procedures, environmental qualification gap analysis, and others) on equipment level and aircraft level
 * You will as the liaison between the lab test team and the flight test team to coordinate verification activities
 * You will supportthe validation and overseeing the verification activities of the whole Avionics system
 * You will supportthe system level / component level milestones (e.g., PDR / CDR / TRR)
 * You will supportthe development assurance activities (e.g. system audits with authorities for ARP-4754A compliance demonstration)

 * You will provide support for formal audits and exchanges with EASA
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor’s degree in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering or equivalent
 * Minimum 5 years of proven experience in aerospace development
 * Good knowledge and practical expertise on the system development lifecycle according to ARP4754A
 * Experience in the Avionics functions and technology for the communication, navigation, surveillance, indication, crew alerting, and data recording
 * Knowledge of the certification deliverables for the Type Certificate programs in CS-25/23/29/27 programs
 * Knowledge of the aviation standards such as ARP4761 and DO-160

title: FBW System Engineer - Pilot Controls (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You are a Senior System engineer experienced in the development of complex systems and you are passionate about making a difference in eVTOL aviation. You have substantial experience in system architecture and requirements engineering and a profound knowledge of the verification and validation aspects in aviation, and in particular flight control system and pilot controls. Within a multi-disciplinary team, you will coordinate between the various teams and systems to ensure a successful certification of the pilot control input concept of the Volocopter aircraft. You will shape the future of how pilots control an eVTOL aircraft.


 * You will support with requirements management at flight control level with a focus on pilot controls (including e.g. functional-, safety-, regulatory-, environmental-, human factors, and performance requirements)
 * You will provide system-level expert for coordination and alignment with various internal departments, flight testing but also certification authorities
 * You will support with the generation of tests (including safety), drawings, and design specifications
 * You will coordinateand manage an external supplier
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Engineering degree (MSc or higher), preferably in aerospace engineering
 * At least 6 years of professional experience in systems engineering for complex systems (ideally aviation-related and in flight control system and pilot controls)
 * Knowledge of aviation standards and guidelines (DO-160, DO-178, and DO-254 in line with the ARP4754A, ARP4761)
 * Knowledge of certification processes (Part 21) and requirements under EASA (CS-23,CS-25,CS-27,CS-29, ideally SC-VTOL).
 * Highly skilled and effective in technical writing and communicating with others
 * You have worked in V-Cycle and agile/scrum environments and have an awareness of the methodologies and used tools (e.g. Jira, SAFe)
 * Experience with systems engineering tools (e.g. DOORS, SysML, etc.)
 * Ideally theoretical knowledge about flight testing, flight physics or electrical systems
 * A structured way of working and a high sense of reliability and accountability
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

Requirements

title: Flight Test Specialist Engineer - Electric Propulsion System (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You will be a member of our Flight Test Team, providing technical and operational expertise in Electric Propulsion Systems, (EPS) for Ground and Flight tests of crewed and uncrewed configurations. Tests will usually be conducted locally, (Bruchsal/Lahr) but may involve campaigns at remote locations from time to time.

You will work closely with our engineering and EPS rig testing teams to assist our flight testing process and to ensure the required readiness for test in time, on cost and quality. In addition, you will manage activities related to the aircraft DMU. As a Senior FTSE, you will be a mentor to more junior engineers, and have opportunities for technical guidance. Volocopter has an established Flight Test Organization as part of our EASA Part21J Design Organization Approval (DOA).


 * You are involved with planning, monitoring, and optimizing Ground and Flight Test activities for electric aircraft development and certification purposes on your specialities (EPS) for the overall functions of a complete aircraft
 * You assist withaircraft preparation, inspection, and repair pre/post-test
 * You take care of the mechanical integration of FTI systems into the aircraft and coordination of interfaces with affected systems
 * You are involved in the assessment and documentation of tests including troubleshooting and development of standardized analysis and reporting tools
 * You work on engineering projects, the solution of which requires technological advances and related development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master’s degree in Aeronautical Engineering or equivalent technical education
 * 15+ years of experience as an Engineer involved in aeronautical development and certification process
 * Experience in electric propulsion systems
 * Experience in planning, monitoring and examining propulsion systems testing
 * Experience in Siemens NX or other CAD design and query tools
 * Knowledge of the English language at a professional level
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Education or experience in rotorcraft flight testing
 * Aircraft MRO experience
 * Experience as an MRB/Liaison Engineer, or as a Flight Test Analysis Engineer/FTSE
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System Engineer – Electric Propulsion (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your crew during this flight:

Our Electric Propulsion System consisting of state-of-the-art battery, power distribution and controlled electric motors are key to making Volocopter’s products extremely safe to fly. With your specific experience in the development of electrical system for aviation or in integrating electric propulsion components into mobility products, you contribute directly to the certification of this uniquely safe and simple flight experience. As an integral part of our Electrical Propulsion System (EPS) development team, you ensure that the proper system development processes are followed by the battery, power distribution and electric motors design teams.

Your mission during this flight:


 * As System Engineer you will work closely with colleagues in multiple disciplines to evaluate requirements, design descriptions, functions etc., at system and component level to meet aircraft level needs
 * Support the teams for system and aircraft level requirements assessments
 * Review supplier documents, e.g.,  requirement specifications, design description documents, planning documents
 * Specify and support the validation and verification activities of aircraft and component requirements according to ARP-4754A
 * Support system level / component level milestones (e.g., PDR / CDR / TRR)
 * Provide support for formal audits and exchanges with EASA, as needed
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent
 * Strong knowledge and several years of experience with systems engineering, requirement management, and system architecture in aviation (ARP4754) or other complex product development
 * Knowledge of certification and development processes
 * Proficient in at least one requirements management tool (e.g., Doors, Integrity)
 * Team player, confident in technical discussions, ability to organize and “get things done”
 * Fluent in English
   
   

Preferred skills:

title: Konstruktions- und Testingenieur (w/m/d)
description:
Hallo! Danke, dass du vorbeischaust 👋.

Liegt Dir der Kampf gegen den Klimawandel am Herzen? Willst du etwas für nachhaltigen zukünftigen Wohlstand tun? Dann such nicht weiter – Du bist bei uns genau richtig!

Wir suchen einen Konstruktions- und Testingenieur zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Offenburg. Es handelt sich um eine hybride Position mit typischerweise 1-2 Home-Office-Tagen pro Woche (abhängig von der tatsächlichen Arbeitssituation). Du wirst mit unserem multidisziplinären Team zusammenarbeiten, um unsere Ultrahochtemperatur-Elektroheizer zur Dekarbonisierung von Industrieöfen zu entwickeln und zu testen.

Was Du machen wirst:

Innerhalb vom 1. Monat:


 * Du wirst mit den Aufgaben Deiner Kollegen/innen vertraut gemacht.
 * Du wirst in unsere Technologie eingeführt und nimmst an unseren Entwicklungsprozessen teil.
 * Du machst Dich mit unseren Designstandards und deren Anwendung vertraut.
 * Du fühst gemeinsam mit einem/einer Kollegen/in erste Tests mit einem Prototyp durch.
   
   

Innerhalb von 3 Monaten wirst Du:


 * Eigenständing Konstruktionsaufgaben und die Erstellung von technischen Zeichnungen durchführen.
 * Mit unseren Lieferanten in Kontakt treten oder neue Lieferanten finden, um unsere Ideen zu diskutieren.
 * Du planst und baust selbstständig einen Versuchsaufbau auf.
   
   

Innerhalb von 6 Monaten wirst Du:


 * Eigenständige Produktentwicklung vom Konzept über Vordimensionierung und erste Entwürfe bis zur Serienfertigung und Diskussion mit dem Team.
 * Tests eigenständig durchführen und für eine sorgfältige Dokumentation der Ergebnisse sorgen.
 * Neue Ideen einbringen, die unsere gesamte Entwicklung voranbringen.
   
   

Was Du in das Team einbringst:


 * Techniker, Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in Maschinenbau, Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik oder einem verwandten Bereich.
 * Ein ausgeprägtes technisches Verständnis (Funktion, Herstellbarkeit, Montage)
 * CAD-Erfahrung (z. B. Inventor oder ähnliche Software)
 * Vollständige Beherrschung der deutschen Sprache (C2) für die Kommunikation mit unseren Zulieferern
 * Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift für die Kommunikation mit dem Team, unseren Kunden und unseren Zulieferern
   
   

Noch besser, wenn Du Folgendes mitbringst:


 * Berufserfahrung, insbesondere in der Entwicklung, Prüfung und Herstellung von Hochtemperatur- und Keramikprodukten
 * Eigeninitiative und selbständige Arbeitsweise.
 * Ausgezeichnete Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in einem Team zu arbeiten.
 * Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, technische Informationen zu präsentieren.
 * Bitte beachtete, dass es sich um eine hybride Position handelt, die mindestens 3 Tage pro Woche vor Ort in Offenburg erfordert. **
   
   

Wir wissen, dass ein Mensch mehr ist als das, was in seinem Lebenslauf steht. Wenn Du nicht sicher ob, ob Sie das richtige Profil für diese Stelle haben, klick einfach auf die Schaltfläche „Bewerben" und versuche es!

Was ist für Dich drin?

Arbeiten bei HyperHeat


 * Wir sind ein Startup-Unternehmen im Bereich climate tech. Du wirst uns bei unserer Mission unterstützen, den Klimawandel zu bekämpfen und einen echten Unterschied machen!
 * Du wirst alles über unser Unternehmen, unsere Geschichte, unser Team und unsere Arbeitsweise erfahren und erhalten eine umfassende praktische Einarbeitung.
 * Wir sind ein kleines, eingespieltes Team, das Wert auf Teamwork, offene Gespräche und eine flache Struktur legt. Du wirst direkt mit den Gründern zusammenarbeiten.
 * Bei uns dreht sich alles um Wachstum und Lernen, daher ist unser Feedback stets positiv und hilfreich.
 * Das Team wird von unterstützenden und ansprechbaren Managern geführt, die Deine Arbeit anerkennen und belohnen.
 * Du wirst Teil eines Teams sein, das gerne zusammenarbeitet, sich gegenseitig hilft, Erkenntnisse austauscht und Erfolge erzielt und feiert.
 * Wir legen Wert darauf, dass jeder seine Stimme erhebt, und halten 1:1-Gespräche und Teambesprechungen ab, damit alles reibungslos läuft.
 * Wir sprechen hier Englisch, so dass alle auf derselben Seite stehen und reibungslos kommunizieren können.
   
   

Und einige Vorteile, die Sie glücklich machen werden:


 * Gelegenheit zu schnellem beruflichem Wachstum und praktischer Erfahrung in einem Startup-Umfeld.
 * Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice-Optionen, die auf Deinen Lebensstil zugeschnitten sind.
 * 30 Tage Jahresurlaub für optimale, gut geladene Batterien.
 * Jährliches Weihnachtsessen, das von den Gründern ausgerichtet wird.
 * Laptop und Zubehör werden nach Deinen Wünschen zur Verfügung gestellt.
 * Regelmäßige teambildende Aktivitäten.
 * Zugang zu einem Programm zur Unterstützung der psychischen Gesundheit.
   
   

Wer wir sind:

Hyperheat ist ein junges Climate Tech Start-up mit erfahrenen Gründern und dem Ziel, eine erneuerbare Wärmelösung für die energieintensive Industrien zu entwickeln. Industrielle Grundprodukte wie Stahl, Zement, Chemikalien, Glas und Papier bilden die materielle Grundlage moderner Gesellschaften. Der Wärmebedarf für ihre Herstellung ist jedoch für etwa 20 % der menschlichen CO2-Emissionen (oder 7,5 Gt CO2 pro Jahr) verantwortlich, die durch die Verbrennung fossiler Brennstoffe entstehen - daher ist dies einer der letzten großen Sektoren, für den es noch keine attraktiven, nachhaltigen Dekarbonisierungslösungen gibt.

Die Produkte von Hyperheat werden den kompletten benötigten Temperaturbereich bis 2000°C abdecken und damit fast jeden Gasbrenner in der Industrie ersetzen. Unsere Lösung wird kostengünstiger sein als der fossile Stand der Technik und zu einer neuen Grundlage für den globalen Wohlstand beitragen. Im Mittelpunkt der Entwicklung steht ein langlebiger und kostengünstiges elektrisches Heizsystem, der ggf. in Verbindung mit Speichern rund um die Uhr industrielle Prozesswärme aus annähernd CO2 freien Wasser-, PV- und/oder Windstrom liefern kann.

Einstellungsprozess


 * Vorstellungsgespräch mit einem Teammitglied (Online).
 * Vorstellungsgespräch mit dem einstellenden Manager (Online).
 * Kleine Hausaufgabe, um die tatsächliche Arbeit zu simulieren.
 * Hausaufgaben-Interview (Online).
 * Skill & Team Interview mit den Teammitgliedern (vor Ort in unserem Büro in Offenburg).
 * Referenzprüfung mit zwei zur Verfügung gestellten Referenzen.
 * Entscheidung.
   
   

Bei HyperHeat legen wir großen Wert auf integrative Arbeitspraktiken und vielfältige Teams, weshalb wir Bewerbungen von verschiedenen, unterrepräsentierten Bevölkerungsgruppen besonders fördern. Wenn Sie es vorziehen, in Teilzeit oder als Jobsharing zu arbeiten, werden wir Ihnen die Arbeit erleichtern.

title: Senior Automation Engineer (m/f/x)
description:
Skeleton's Scale-Up team is looking for a driven

Senior Automation Engineer

with the vision to match our ambition.

In this role, you would implement and support in implementation of the state-of-the-art technologies for the future plant automation.

Your tasks in the net zero journey:


 * Preparation of automation environment according to group strategy/standards
 * Development and improvement of existing systems
 * Maintaining automation systems, operate them as well as supporting on integration
 * Close cooperation with all departments in terms of automation and process development
 * Actively supporting the commissioning during the startup phase of new systems/machinery
 * Carrying out analyzes in the event of system malfunctions, quality or process problems
 * Analysis and elimination of bottlenecks in production with the stipulation of partial or full automation
 * Implementation and support in implementation of state-of-the-art technologies for the future plant automation
 * Supplier communication according to the group automation standards
 * Troubleshooting of equipment
 * Monitoring of systems and data analysis of automation equipment
 * Ownership of specific work packages for automation projects
 * Development of automation solutions according to group standards with machine suppliers
 * Network technology, control and regulation technology
   
   
   

Requirements

We don't expect to master it all. At Skeleton, you'll have the support of the team and we work together to achieve our goals. However, there are requirements you should be able to fulfill to succeed in this role:


 * Successfully completed studies as an Engineer / Technician in the field of automation, electrical engineering, information technology, mechatronics or equivalent education
 * 2-5 years of professional experience in a production environment, in special machine construction, automotive industry on the planning of automation solutions
 * Experience in the partial and full automation of manufacturing processes.
 * Good experience in programming (PLC, HMI, robotics) - ideal: TIA Portal, WinCC, C#, C++, Scout, Fanuc, Yaskawa
 * Experience with MES applications and industrialized networks as well as in the IT / OT area desirable
 * Demonstrate success in the given field of activity and have already implemented projects.
 * Supervised the development and commissioning of production systems desirable.
 * Structured working style, you are project-focused, being on time and on the budget, dynamic, flexible
 * Have fluent German and English language skills
   
   
   

Benefits

We're not just about energy storage. We're about redefining energy for a net zero future, and we'd love for you to be a part of our journey.


 * We offer flexible working hours, with the possibility of mobile working without core working hours and sufficient freedom for your own ideas
 * A flat hierarchy culture - fostering our great working atmosphere
 * Use the training budget to expand your knowledge and competencies
 * Helpfulness among colleagues is not just an empty phrase but a practice every day
 * A motivating opportunity for continuous growth at Skeleton.
 * An additional day off every year for your birthday
 * Use our Edenred Voucher Card for your shopping experience with a top-up every month
 * We offer a company pension scheme for your financial security in the future
 * Be active & participate in our internal sports challenges (SkelFitness)
 * We have a pet-friendly office
 * We celebrate our successes with Team Events, Summer & New Year's parties, and other initiatives!
   
   

We're not just about energy storage. We're about redefining energy for a net zero future, and we'd love for you to be a part of our journey.

About Skeleton

Skeleton Technologies is a Global Cleantech 100 company and a technology leader in high-power energy storage for transportation, grid, automotive, and industrial applications.

For us, developing and producing the best energy storage solutions is a means to an end: helping companies to reduce CO2 emissions and save energy.

We work with some of the largest companies in the world from automotive and industrial OEMs to truck fleet operators and aerospace prime contractors. Our products decrease CO2 emissions and fuel consumption, improve power quality, and empower wider electrification of the biggest industries globally.

Our supercapacitor and SuperBattery energy storage technologies, based on patented curved graphene, represent the biggest technological advancement in the industry in the last 20 years and the use of this innovative material provides our products with an unparalleled advantage in power and energy density.

Skeleton Technologies is located in multiple locations: headquarters in Tallinn (Estonia), manufacturing in Großröhrsdorf, materials development in Bitterfeld-Wolfen, several locations in Finland, and an office in Berlin. Currently, we are about to open the largest supercapacitor factory in the world in the Leipzig area, Germany. Further expansion plans will shortly lead Skeleton to France.

title: Requirements Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Deine Aufgaben

 * Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für das Anforderungsmanagement in komplexen IT-Projekten und erarbeitest gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden aus der öffentlichen Verwaltung Lösungen, die den besonderen Herausforderungen des Sektors gerecht werden.
 * Du erfasst, analysierst und spezifizierst sowohl funktionale als auch nicht-funktionale Anforderungen und sorgst dafür, dass diese klar dokumentiert und nachverfolgt werden.
 * Du übersetzt die Anforderungen der Fachbereiche in umsetzbare Epics und User Stories (agil) oder Lasten-/Pflichtenhefte (klassisch) und unterstützt damit die technische Umsetzung.
 * In enger Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern stellst du sicher, dass die Anforderungen während des gesamten Projektverlaufs eingehalten und kontinuierlich angepasst werden.
 * Du arbeitest in interdisziplinären Teams und trägst dazu bei, dass öffentliche Projekte nachhaltig und benutzerzentriert umgesetzt werden.




Dein Profil

 * Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im IT-Bereich.
 * Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Requirements Engineer (m/w/d) mit, vorzugsweise in Projekten der öffentlichen Verwaltung.
 * Deine Kenntnisse in den gängigen Tools und Methoden (MS Office, MS Project, MS Visio, UML, BPMN) sind fundiert, und du beherrschst deren Anwendung zur Anforderungsdokumentation und Modellierung.
 * Du hast Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Projekten nach klassischen und agilen Vorgehensmodellen und kennst dich bestens mit Jira und Confluence aus.
 * Du hast Erfahrung im Umgang mit gängigen KI-Tools und die Fähigkeit, diese effektiv in bestehende Arbeitsprozesse zu integrieren.
 * Zertifikate wie IREB oder Product Owner (CSPO, PSPO) sind ein Plus.
 * Du bist ein echter Teamplayer und kommunizierst sicher und freundlich mit unseren Kunden – sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch.




Unsere Benefits

 * Eine offene und wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien, in der du dich und deine Ideen einbringen kannst.
 * Wir fördern deine persönliche und fachliche Weiterentwicklung durch zahlreiche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.
 * Attraktive Benefits wie Fahrradleasing, Urban Sports-Mitgliedschaften und eine moderne technische Ausstattung.
 * Zudem bieten wir flexible Arbeitszeiten und unterstützen eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance.




Kontaktinformationen

Siehst du dich als Teil der Mission, Deutschlands digitale Zukunft zu gestalten? Dann startet hier und jetzt den Countdown für deine Bewerbung bei der Nummer Eins für Open Source Lösungen im E Government. Willkommen an Bord!




Noch Fragen? Aber gern! Sprich uns einfach an: Unser Recruitingteam erreichst du unter Tel. 0211/63550180 oder per Mail (hr@publicplan.de)

Bitte beachte, dass ein Wohnsitz in Deutschland oder in Spanien vorhanden sein muss.




Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/ Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität.

Unsere Informationen zum Datenschutz für Bewerber (m/w/d) findest du hier.

Wir bitten Personaldienstleister und Headhunter auf eine unaufgeforderte Zusendung von Bewerber-Profilen zu verzichten da diese nicht gewünscht sind und demzufolge als Spam behandelt und nicht beachtet bzw. gelöscht werden.

title: Lead Engineer - Interiors / Door Panels / Headliner
description:
Lead Engineer - Interiors / Door Panels / Headliner




We are currently partnered with a leading automotive component manufacturer specializing in interior systems looking to expand their team in Germany with a Lead Engineer for Automotive Interiors to work on the design/development of interior system components.




This position is based in Munich, Germany.

 * Ensure all geometric requirements are analyzed and met at key milestones.
 * Develop 3D and 2D layouts, including GD&T, attachment strategies, and conceptual design surfaces.
 * Draft requirements, specifications, and design rules, while researching the latest tooling and production methodologies.
 * Coordinate with internal teams, suppliers, and stakeholders across various locations to ensure successful project delivery.




Key Requirements:

 * Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
 * Minimum of 4 years as a Lead Engineer in automotive interior systems, with a track record of managing at least one full development cycle.
 * proven track record in Headliner / Door panel or IP development.
 * Fluent in German and proficient in English.

If you are interested in this Lead Engineer position, please send a CV to ts@eu-recruit.com

title: Test Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Sicoya is a technology leader in silicon photonics based interconnect solutions with headquarter in Berlin, Germany. We offer monolithically integrated semiconductor chips and transceivers for next generation data center. The team consists of highly professional design engineers and managers with many years of experience in bringing state of the art products to the market. In this position you will dive into a unique challenge, as you are involved in the design and the development of the next generation of optical transceivers.

Tasks

 * Independent project planning and monitoring of status and progress of performed actions
 * Automatization of test procedures and integration of processes in the production line; Optimization of the volume production flow
 * Installation of appropriate test setups, performing of GR&R analysis and test measurements
 * Performing of failure mode error analyses, review related information and evaluate counter measures
 * Documentation of process development progress, creating of work instructions and training of other engineers and operators
 * Cycle time optimization of test processes

Requirements


 * versatile engineer with profound background in optic and electronic testing with industrial background, preferably with experience in the semiconductor, electronic or optical industry

 * Profound knowledge in RF testing
 * Proactive problem-solving skills
 * Team player that thrives in a dynamic working environment
 * Professional working proficiency in English is mandatory and knowledge of German is an asset
 * Willingness to travel
   
   
   

Benefits

 * Regular team events and team building measures

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
Join Our Innovative Team!




Are you ready to elevate your career in a dynamic environment where your expertise in instrumentation and control (I&C) will make a real impact? At our cutting-edge laboratories, you’ll play a crucial role in ensuring the highest standards of quality, safety, and reliability in automation technology.




What You’ll Do




Test and Evaluation:

 * Take charge of the entire testing process—from preparation and implementation to thorough documentation and follow-up on examinations.
 * Innovate by developing test methods, tools, and setups tailored to regulatory, normative, and customer-specific needs.
 * Ensure the integrity of our testing by reviewing results for validity and reliability in accordance with DIN EN ISO/IEC 17025.
 * Dive deep into data interpretation and create detailed test reports that showcase your findings.




Documentation and Consulting:

 * Share your expertise by documenting and disclosing test methods and processes.
 * Be a trusted advisor to customers, guiding them through their orders with confidence.




Development and Maintenance:

 * Unleash your creativity by designing and developing state-of-the-art test equipment and systems.
 * Take ownership of adjusting and verifying test equipment, and perform essential maintenance on complex devices.




What You Bring to the Table




Your Qualifications:

 * Completed technical vocational training plus two years of specialized training as a state-certified technician, or a degree in electrical engineering (or equivalent qualifications).
 * Experience in the development, manufacturing, or testing of measuring instruments (think oscilloscopes, bipolar voltage testers, insulation monitoring devices).
 * A wealth of professional experience paired with in-depth specialist knowledge.
 * Experience and understanding of the following standards; 61557 - 8, 61243 or 61010 – 1




Your Skills:

 * Strong written and spoken English skills.
