title: Flight Test Instrumentation Engineer  (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You will be a member of our flight test team, planning and conducting both manned and unmanned flight test campaigns and continuing to build up the Flight Test Organization. Tests will usually be conducted locally but may involve campaigns at remote locations from time to time. You will work closely with our team to design, integrate and operate the Instrumentation System to help with the flight test campaign of our new aircraft.


 * Provide planning for the system design and installation in conformity with the company strategy.
 * Conceptual and detailed design of the integration of various FTI components that combined will act together as a system.
 * Ensure adherence to flight safety analysis and DOA design handbook – the design has a direct impact on the safety of flight (SOF).
 * Build and test the system, both air and ground segment to ensure high reliability and greater dispatchability of the test vehicle.
 * Lead the FTI flight operations as assigned, coordinating a team of FTITech on the field and operate the ground station ensuring data and comms to the crew.
 * Supply chain management to ensure parts are provided in accordance with the flight test plan.
 * Propose & implement instrumentation solutions for ground tests on test aircraft as off aircraft (radio receiving signals for voice and data, as well as the management of significant amount of software for data processing and pos-test data sharing)
 * Design and agree with different engineering teams how to incorporate large and complex system in the flight test vehicle.
 * Provide input to Project Management and Test Engineering Lead on project performance against established milestones
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor’s or Master degree in Aerospace, Electrical Engineering or a comparable degree
 * 7+ years of experience as FTIE involved in aircraft development & certification process.
 * Experience in contributing to building up a Flight Test Organization, structure working processes (design rules handbooks, installation instructions)
 * Very good understanding of electrical, electronics to mechanics and structures
 * Problem solving skills
 * Business fluent in English. Other languages like German would be a plus
 * Extensive flexible mobility in order to support FTI operations on aircraft, being deployed with the test aircraft at multiple test locations
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Experience in Sensor/Wiring installation
 * Experience with CAD/Schematic drawings tools
 * Basic programming skills, like Python
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Flight Test Specialist Engineer - Structures (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You will be a member of our Flight Test Team, providing technical and operational expertise in Structures & Dynamics, for ground and flight tests of crewed and uncrewed configurations. Tests will usually be conducted locally, (Bruchsal/Lahr) but may involve campaigns at remote locations from time to time.

You will work closely with our engineering and structural rig testing teams to assist our flight testing process and to ensure the required readiness for test in time, on cost and quality. In addition, you will manage activities related to the aircraft DMU. As a Senior FTSE, you will be a mentor to more junior engineers, and have opportunities for technical guidance. Volocopter has an established Flight Test Organization as part of our EASA Part21J Design Organization Approval (DOA).


 * You will be involved with planning, monitoring, and optimizing Ground and Flight Test activities for electric aircraft development and certification purposes on your specialities (Structures) for the overall functions of a complete aircraft
 * You will assist with aircraft preparation, inspection, and repair pre/post-test (in particular on composite structures)
 * You will take care of aircraft snags and findings as well as the implementation of aircraft configuration changes required for specific flight test campaign, including liaising with design engineering, production and maintenance when required
 * You will support flight test operation as telemetry crew for structures-related topic
 * You will be involved in the assessment and documentation of tests including troubleshooting and development of standardized analysis and reporting tools
 * You will work on engineering projects, the solution of which requires technological advances and related development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * 10+ years of experience as an Engineer involved in aeronautical development and certification process
 * Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent technical education
 * Experience in metallic and composite structures from design and maintenance/repair perspective
 * Experience in planning, monitoring and analysing envelope expansions, dynamics, loads, vibro-acoustics and flutter tests
 * Experience in designing (using CAD programs such as Siemens NX or equivalent), analysis for structural strength assessment
 * Experience in using telemetry software (such as Curtiss-Wright IADS or equivalent) for GUI development and monitoring real-time critical parameters during flight test operations
 * Communicative team player, well organized with a proven ability to get things done
 * Knowledge of the English language at a professional level
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Education or experience in rotorcraft flight testing
 * Aircraft MRO experience
 * Experience as an MRB/Liaison Engineer
   
   

Additional Information

Our Volocopter flight includes:


 * Fast-growing high-tech company with a superb network of investors and partners 
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch! 
 * Personal accountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive compensation package
   
   

Diversity at Volocopter:

Our differences are what make us great. Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential.

title: Test Engineer for Infotainment/IVI Testing of Connectivity/Navigation/Tuner
description:
We are searching intelligent and innovative employees. If you are interested in working for a dynamic company with flat hierarchy, we look forward to receiving your application.




Your tasks:




 * Analyze System requirements and check the feasibility of testing in simulated environment and in Vehicle
 * Develop Test cases for System Requirements (Infotainment System: Connectivity, Tuner, Navigation, Telematics, Automotive infotainment HMI, etc.)
 * Test case Automation
 * Test execution on Bench and in-Vehicle integration Tests
 * Bug Tracking & Reporting




Your profile:




 * Drive Test Experience in EU region (Border crossing, Location points and Route planning for Drive Test)
 * BT/Connectivity basic knowledge: Pairing/Connectivity; Calling features (Active calls/Merge/Conference); Messaging (SMS/MMS/ email); Contacts Upload/Download; BT Audio; IOP (Inter Operability) test experience, and BT/Connectivity Advanced knowledge: Deep understanding of Profiles (A2DP,HFP AVCRP) Testing; Should have experience with capturing Connectivity logs (BT, Wifi); Basic knowledge of Bluetooth Standards / versions
 * Smartphone Projection Technologies: Android Auto (wired, wireless); Carplay (wired,wireless), Mirracast, Mirrorlink, Baiducar life; Good to have: Knowledge of Certification of Smartphone projection (AAuto, CarPlay)
 * Navigation basic knowledge: Destination Search; Route Guidance; POI Search; Favorites; OFF Route/Re Routing /Map Display/Zoom; Icons/Roadworks/Address Format and Navigation advanced knowledge: Dead Reckoning; Traffic updates
 * Telematics/Online: Experience with Over the Air Update; Remote services / Information service; Emergency Call; Personalization / User specific registration
 * HMI (Human Machine Interface) / GUI: Strong experience with testing Automotive infotainment HMI (screen content, screen transition)
 * Relevant educational background and Fluent in English




You can expect ...




 * Experience in exciting and international projects
 * Continuous salary development
 * Da Vinci Corporate Benefits
 * Training and language courses
 * Appreciation, motivation and commitment




Nothing provides more motivation than success. Da Vinci Engineering is highly committed to ensuring the own employees’ success. Become a part of us!

title: Test Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Sicoya is a technology leader in silicon photonics based interconnect solutions with headquarter in Berlin, Germany. We offer monolithically integrated semiconductor chips and transceivers for next generation data center. The team consists of highly professional design engineers and managers with many years of experience in bringing state of the art products to the market. In this position you will dive into a unique challenge, as you are involved in the design and the development of the next generation of optical transceivers.

Tasks


 * Development, verification and implementation of volume production test processes in the field of semiconductor and electro-optical industry
 * Independent project planning and monitoring of status and progress of performed actions
 * Automatization of test procedures and integration of processes in the production line; Optimization of the volume production flow
 * Installation of appropriate test setups, performing of GR&R analysis and test measurements
 * Performing of failure mode error analyses, review related information and evaluate counter measures
 * Documentation of process development progress, creating of work instructions and training of other engineers and operators
 * Cycle time optimization of test processes
 * Organization and supervision of test procedure and equipment transfer including release procedures to other facilities
 * Technical contact to supplier, partners at other facilities and technology partners
   
   
   

Requirements


 * versatile engineer with profound background in optic and electronic testing with industrial background, preferably with experience in the semiconductor, electronic or optical industry
 * +3 years of experience in industrial environments
 * Profound knowledge in RF testing
 * Proactive problem-solving skills
 * Team player that thrives in a dynamic working environment
 * Professional working proficiency in English is mandatory and knowledge of German is an asset
 * Willingness to travel
   
   
   

Benefits


 * High degree of personal responsibility within a flat company hierarchy
 * Ambitious internationally expanding team
 * Various future carrier opportunities for every career level
 * A relaxed and inspiring working environment with lounge area, free drinks and fruits
 * Regular team events and team building measures
   
   
   

Are you interested in working with us? Then we may just be waiting to hear from you. Please send us your CV and a motivation letter right here

Sicoya is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion or belief, sexual orientation, disability or age.

title: (Senior) Product Manager (w/m/d)
description:
Westernacher Solutions…

…ist einer der führenden IT-Beratungs- und Lösungsanbieter für die Bereiche eGovernment & eJustice und mit mehr als 150 Mitarbeitenden in Berlin, Heidelberg, Bad Kreuznach und remote.

Warum Und Wie Wir Den Public Sector Digitalisieren


 * Wir sind ein sicheres, bodenständiges Unternehmen mit langfristig stabiler Auftragslage
 * Wir entwickeln nachhaltige, gesellschaftlich relevante Produkte und Services
 * Wir sind ein agiles mittelständisches Unternehmen mit einer offenen Fehlerkultur
   
   

Was Sie erwartet…


 * ganzheitliche Verantwortung und Steuerung des gesamten IT-Produkt-Lebenszyklus (Architektur, Weiterentwicklung, Support, Vertrieb, Marketing)
 * zentraler Ansprechpartner (w/m/d) und Schnittstelle zwischen dem Team und unserem Kunden sowie weiteren Stakeholdern
 * Identifikation und Analyse kundenspezifischer Requirements und Erstellung der daraus resultierenden Epics und Stories
 * Abwägung der technischen Machbarkeit in Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Entwicklungsteam
 * Reporting an das Management sowie weitere Interessengruppen
   
   

Was Sie mitbringen…


 * erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
 * mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrungen im IT-Produktmanagement
 * Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Businessplänen und -modellen
 * Erfahrungen bei der Einführung und dem Betrieb eines Softwareproduktes
 * fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit agilen Methoden, idealerweise als Product Owner, Business Analyst, technischer Projektleiter oder Softwarearchitekt
 * Erfahrungen in der Formulierung von Anforderungen für Entwicklungsteams (z.B. User Stories)
 * hohe soziale Kompetenz, Kommunikationssicherheit sowie idealerweise Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit verteilten und interdisziplinären Teams
 * fließende Deutschkenntnisse und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
   
   

Was wir versprechen…


 * Sinn Digitalisierung der Verwaltung und Justiz mit hochsicheren, hochverfügbaren Diensten
 * Freiraum: Gleitzeit, 30 Tage Urlaub, Freizeitausgleich bei Mehrarbeit, viel Entscheidungsfreiheit, gute Work-Life-Balance
 * Mobiles Arbeiten: bis zu 60 % remote an unseren Standorten
 * Benefits: Aktienprogramm (die Firma gehört den aktiven Mitarbeitenden), Mobilitätszuschuss, Team- und Firmenevents, zentral gelegenes Büro direkt am Bergmannkiez
   
   

Sollte Sie die Stelle begeistern, aber Ihre bisherige Erfahrung nicht perfekt mit den gesuchten Qualifikationen übereinstimmen, senden Sie uns dennoch gerne Ihre Unterlagen zu! Für uns zählt vor allem die Motivation hinter der Bewerbung sowie die Offenheit Neues zu lernen. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung - unabhängig von Ihrem Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung, Ethnie, Religion und sozioökonomischen Hintergrund!

Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne unter [email protected] zur Verfügung.



Nähere Informationen zum Umgang mit Ihren personenbezogenen Daten zum Zwecke der Bearbeitung Ihrer Bewerbung durch die Westernacher Solutions GmbH sowie Ihren Rechten finden Sie unter Datenschutz.

Further information on the use of your personal data by Westernacher Solutions GmbH for the purpose of validating your application as well as information on your rights can be found here.
